brya: <entryFree id="n5745" type="greek" key="bry^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">brua/</foreign>, <sense id="n5745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> myrice <hi rend="ital">and</hi> tamarice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 42, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bryanion: <entryFree id="n5746" type="main" key="Bry^a^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bryănĭon</orth>, v. Bruanion.</entryFree>
bryaxis: <entryFree id="n5747" type="main" key="Bry^axis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bryaxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bru/acis</foreign>, <sense id="n5747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, praef. § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:73 al" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 19, § 73 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
bryazon: <entryFree id="n5748" type="main" key="Bry^azon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bryazon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bryazus: <entryFree id="n5749" type="main" key="Bry^azus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bryazus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Bithynian god and of his temple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 18, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bryges: <entryFree id="n5750" type="main" key="Bryges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bryges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emigrants from Asia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bryllion: <entryFree id="n5751" type="main" key="Bryllion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bryllion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Propontis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bryon: <entryFree id="n5752" type="greek" key="bry^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bryon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bru/on</foreign>. <sense id="n5752.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Moss;</hi> esp. the kind otherwise called sphagnos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 50, § 108</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5752.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The grape - formed blossom of the silver poplar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 61, § 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5752.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant growing upon the seashore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with leaves like lettuce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 49, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:56" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 8, 33, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:110" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 36, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bryonia: <entryFree id="n5753" type="greek" key="bry^o_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bryōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bruwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bryony;</hi> of two kinds: <hi rend="ital">the white</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 59" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 59</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the black</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:250" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bu: <entryFree id="n5754" type="greek" key="bu1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bu</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">bou</foreign>, <sense id="n5754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek prefix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in composition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expresses the idea of greatness</hi>: Graeci assueti magnis et amplis rebus praeponere <foreign lang="greek">bou</foreign>, a magnitudine scilicet bovis. Hic est, quod grandes pueri <foreign lang="greek">bou/paidas</foreign> appellant et mariscam ficum <foreign lang="greek">bou/sukon</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 4</bibl> [cf. Engl. horse-cucumber, elephant folio, etc.].</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n5755" type="gloss" key="bu2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bu</orth>, v. bua.</entryFree>
bua: <entryFree id="n5756" type="gloss" key="bua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bu, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. im butum, p. 109 Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n5756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the natural sound made by infants in asking for their drink</hi>, as pappa for their food, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 1 sq.</bibl>; cf. vinibua.</sense></entryFree>
bubalinus: <entryFree id="n5757" type="main" key="bu_ba^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbălīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bubalus</etym>, <sense id="n5757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the African gazelle</hi>: laridum, Val. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubalion: <entryFree id="n5758" type="greek" key="bu_ba^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbălĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bouba/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n5758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild cucumber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubalus: <entryFree id="n5759" type="greek" key="bu_ba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/balos</foreign>, <sense id="n5759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of African stag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gazelle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 15, § 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bū-bălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the gazelle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5759.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The buffalo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild-ox</hi>, = urus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 23:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 23, 4</bibl>; this use of the word is censured by Pliny, 8, 15, 15, § 38.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">būfălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Ven. Fort. Carm. 7, 4, 21.</sense></entryFree>
bubassus: <entryFree id="n5760" type="main" key="Bu_bassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbassus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ăsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bu/bassos</foreign>, Steph., <sense id="n5760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5760.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5760.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbassĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bubassus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5760.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbăsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bubassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 644</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubastis: <entryFree id="n5761" type="main" key="Bu_bastis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbastis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bou/bastis</foreign>. <sense id="n5761.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Pelusian arm of the Nile</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tel-Basta</hi> (i.e. Hill of Bubastis), in the vicinity of the village Benalhassar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbastītes nŏ-mŏs</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">*boubasti/ths nomo/s</foreign>, Strab., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5761.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess Bubastis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was worshipped there;</hi> corresponding to Diana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 691</bibl>; cf. Hdt. 2, 137; 2, 156.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbastius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bubastis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 42</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> BVBASTIVM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5974</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubeium: <entryFree id="n5762" type="main" key="Bubeium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bubeium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubetani: <entryFree id="n5763" type="main" key="Bubeta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bubetāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubile: <entryFree id="n5764" type="main" key="bu_bi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbīle</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvīle</orth>, unus. acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 54</bibl> Müll.; although used by Cato, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 81</bibl>; and by <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stall for oxen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(boves) reicere in bubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit> Ritschl; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubinare: <entryFree id="n5765" type="gloss" key="bubinare"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bubinare</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">buv-</orth>) <itype>est menstruo mulierum sanguine inquinare</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.; cf. Gloss. Isid.</entryFree>
bubleum: <entryFree id="n5766" type="gloss" key="bubleum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bubleum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 32</bibl> Müll. [<foreign lang="greek">*bu/blinos oi=nos</foreign>, Hesiod. Op. 587 Göttl.] <cb n="BUCC" /></sense></entryFree>
bubo: <entryFree id="n5767" type="main" key="bu_bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen> only once <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 462</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 194, 1</bibl>.— Hence given erroneously by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 683</bibl> P. and Rhemn. Palaem. p. 1370 <sense id="n5767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> ib. as <gen>comm.</gen>) [<foreign lang="greek">bu/as, bu=za</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">an owl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the horned owl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strix bubo, Linn., whose cry was considered as ill-boding,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 16, § 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavus bubo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:432" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 432</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:543" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profana avis): funereus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:453" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 453</bibl></cit>: Stygius (since Ascalaphus, son of Acheron or Styx, was changed to an owl; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ascalaphus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:791" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rauci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubone sinistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 734" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 687" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infaustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5768" type="hapax" key="bu^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n5768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry like a bittern</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 42 (al. butio).</sense></entryFree>
bubon: <entryFree id="n5769" type="main" key="Bu_bon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boubw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n5769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubona: <entryFree id="n5770" type="main" key="Bu_bo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the protecting goddess of cattle among the Romans</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 34.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būbetĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for Bubona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bubonium: <entryFree id="n5771" type="greek" key="bu_bo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbōnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boubw/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n5771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant useful against swellings in the groin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> aster Atticus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 19, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubsequa: <entryFree id="n5772" type="main" key="bubse^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bubsĕqua</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bobsĕqua</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">bū-sĕqua</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bos-sequor</etym>, <sense id="n5772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neatherd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herdsman</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 201, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 1</bibl>, n. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubulcarius: <entryFree id="n5773" type="gloss" key="bu^bulca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭbulcārĭus</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">bow/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n5773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ploughman</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat. ( = bubulcus).</sense></entryFree>
bubulcito: <entryFree id="n5774" type="main" key="bu^bulci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭbulcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭbulcĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, Plaut.) [bubulcus], <sense id="n5774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a herdsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drive oxen</hi> (ante- and post-class., and very rare). </sense><sense id="n5774.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulcitarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; App. Flor. n. 6, p. 343, 14.—</sense><sense id="n5774.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bawl like an ox-driver</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 29</bibl> (Sat. Men. 52, 1).</sense></entryFree>
bubulcus: <entryFree id="n5775" type="main" key="bu^bulcus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭbulcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bos, bubulus, <foreign lang="greek">bou=kos</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n5775.0" n="I" level="1"> In a restricted sense, <hi rend="ital">one who ploughs with oxen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ploughman</hi>, = arator (diff. from pastor and armentarius, a herdsman; <cit><quote lang="la">so most freq. in the Script. rerr. rustt.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 4 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 151</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:2" default="NO">1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO">2, 2, 25</bibl>; 2, 5, 2; 2, 12, 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:116" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:151 al" default="NO">11, 151 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5775.1" n="II" level="1"> In a more general sense, <hi rend="ital">a herdsman</hi> (rare, and not before the post-Aug. per.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5776" type="main" key="Bu^bulcus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŭbulcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cognomen of several persons in the</hi> gens Junia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bubulinus: <entryFree id="n5777" type="main" key="bu_bu^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bos</etym>, for bubulus, <sense id="n5777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ox</hi>- (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">only in Veg.): stercus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bubulo: <entryFree id="n5778" type="hapax" key="bu_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bubo</etym>, <sense id="n5778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoot</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">screech like an owl</hi>, Auct. Carm. Phil. 37.</sense></entryFree>
bubulus: <entryFree id="n5779" type="main" key="bu_bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būbŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to cattle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oxen</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cori,</quote> <trans><tr>thongs</tr>, <tr>straps of ox-hide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; and humorously, cottabi, <hi rend="ital">the snapping of such ox-whips</hi> (cf. cottabus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 4</bibl> Lind.; so also monimenta, for <hi rend="ital">lashes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, exuviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>neat cattle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">26: fimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 176</bibl></cit>: lac, <hi rend="ital">cow</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 238</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 51, § 140</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">used esp. freq. in medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 27, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <trans><tr>the flesh of neat cattle</tr>, <tr>beef</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 43, § 156</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">būbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus bubulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 188 sq" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 188 sq.</bibl></cit>: lingua, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> buglossa, <hi rend="ital">ox-tongue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 112</bibl>.—No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
buca: <entryFree id="n5780" type="main" key="Bu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Samnium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bū-cāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Buca</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1032, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucaeda: <entryFree id="n5781" type="hapax" key="bu_caeda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcaeda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bos-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n5781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is whipped with thongs of ox-hide</hi> (cf. bos and bubulus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucardia: <entryFree id="n5782" type="greek" key="bu_cardi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcardĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boukapdi/a</foreign> (oxheart), <sense id="n5782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a kind of turquoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucca: <entryFree id="n5783" type="main" key="bucca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bucca</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">buccha</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred <pb n="254" /> <cb n="BUCE" /> with <foreign lang="greek">bu/zw, buka/nh</foreign>; Fr. bouche</etym>. <sense id="n5783.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The cheek</hi> (puffed or filled out in speaking, eating, etc.; diff. from genae, the side of the face, the cheeks, and from mala, the upper part of the cheek under the eyes; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 156</bibl> sqq.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>; class.): buccam implere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufflare buccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere buccas,</quote> <trans><tr>to write bombast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufflare buccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.—In violent anger (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fusa=n ta\s gna/qous, deina\ fusa=n</foreign>, etc.): quin illis Juppiter ambas Iratus buccas inflet, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictus Gallus ... distortus, ejectā linguā, buccis fluentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluentes pulsataeque buccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit> B. and K.: purpurissatae (<hi rend="ital">rouged</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 35</bibl>.—In blowing the fire: <cit><quote lang="la">buccā foculum excitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:262 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 262 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5783.1" n="b" level="4"> Dicere (scribere) quod or quidquid in buccam venit, a colloq. phrase, <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi> (<hi rend="ital">write</hi>) <hi rend="ital">whatever comes uppermost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 14, 7, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:24:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 24, 5</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also ellipt.: garrimus quidquid in buccam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5783.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5783.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who fills his cheeks in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a declaimer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bawler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curtius et Matho buccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 34</bibl></cit> (jactanticuli, qui tantum buccas inflant et nihil dicunt, Schol.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bucca loquax vetuli cinoedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo durae buccae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 3</bibl></cit>; so of a <hi rend="ital">trumpeter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notaeque per oppida buccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5783.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who stuffs out his cheeks in eating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parasite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5783.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mouthful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucca panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:5" default="NO">10, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5783.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5783.7" n="A" level="2"> From men to animals; <cit><quote lang="la">of croaking frogs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5783.8" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a cavity;</hi> of the knee-joint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buccea: <entryFree id="n5784" type="hapax" key="bucce^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bucca</etym>, <sense id="n5784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a morsel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouthful</hi>, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
buccella: <entryFree id="n5785" type="main" key="buccella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mouthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morsel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:75:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 75, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5785.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Small bread divided among the poor</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 17, 5; cf. Salmas. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buccellaris: <entryFree id="n5786" type="main" key="buccella_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccellāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>buccellatum</etym>, farina, <sense id="n5786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">meal ground from biscuit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5786.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">buccellāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cooking utensil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 23</bibl> (others, bucculari, from buccula, in the same signif.).</sense></entryFree>
buccellatum: <entryFree id="n5787" type="main" key="buccella_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccellātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>buccella</etym>, <sense id="n5787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">biscuit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 8, 2</bibl>; Vulcat. Gall. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pesc. Nig. 10, 4</bibl>; Cod. Th. 7, 4, 6; 7, 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
buccina: <entryFree id="n5788" type="main" key="bucci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccĭna, buccĭnātor, buccĭno</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">buccĭnum</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">buccĭnus</orth>, v. bucina, etc.</entryFree>
bucco: <entryFree id="n5789" type="main" key="bucco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bucco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n5789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [bucca, one who has distended cheeks], <hi rend="ital">a babbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockhead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fool</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bucco = garrulus, quod ceteros oris loquacitate, non sensu exsuperat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi, fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macci et buccones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 325, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bucconiatis: <entryFree id="n5790" type="main" key="bucco^ni^a_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccŏnĭātis vītis</orth>, <sense id="n5790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of vine in Thurium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fruit of which is not gathered until after the first frost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buccula: <entryFree id="n5791" type="main" key="buccu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">būcŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>bucca</etym>. <sense id="n5791.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little cheek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mouth</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressa Cupidinis buccula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 137, 40; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5791.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n5791.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The beaver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that part of a helmet which covers the mouth and cheeks</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">paragnaqi/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucculas tergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 34, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Jun. 3</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 22, 1.—</sense><sense id="n5791.3" n="B" level="2"> Bucculae, <hi rend="ital">two cheeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one on each side of the channel in which the arrow of the catapulta was placed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buccularius: <entryFree id="n5792" type="main" key="buccu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>buccula, II.</etym>, <sense id="n5792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the maker of beavers for helmets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 7</bibl> (6) dub. (Momms. bucularum structores).</sense></entryFree>
bucculentus: <entryFree id="n5793" type="hapax" key="buccu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buccŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>buccula, I.</etym>, <sense id="n5793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having full cheeks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a large mouth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucephalas: <entryFree id="n5794" type="main" key="Bu_ce^pha^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcĕphălas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcĕphăla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 11</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boukefa/las</foreign> (Macedon. = <foreign lang="greek">*bouke/falos</foreign>, that which is arked with the figure of a bullock's head—<foreign lang="greek">bou=s, kefalh/</foreign>—or so called from the breadth of its forehead), <sense id="n5794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the horse of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:23" default="NO">9, 3, 23</bibl>; <cb n="BUCO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Bucephalan, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5794.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcĕphăla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-la</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 23</bibl>; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 8, 8</bibl>; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-lŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*bouke/fala</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a town in India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Hydaspes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Alexander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and named after his horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucephalus: <entryFree id="n5795" type="main" key="Bu_ce^pha^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcĕphălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in the Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buceras: <entryFree id="n5796" type="greek" key="bu_ce^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĕras</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/keras</foreign>, <sense id="n5796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise called faenum Graecum, <hi rend="ital">fenugreek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 120, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucerius: <entryFree id="n5797" type="main" key="bu_ce^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. bucerus.</entryFree>
bucerus: <entryFree id="n5798" type="greek" key="bu_ce^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĕrus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĕrĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 663</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/kerws</foreign>, <sense id="n5798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the horns of a bullock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ox-horned</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): bucerum pecus de bubus dicimus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">bucera saecla,</quote> <trans><tr>the race of horned caltle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 864</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1236</bibl>; imitated by Ovid: armenta, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">buceriae greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 663</bibl></cit> (quoted by <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 27</bibl>, and p. 208, 21).</sense></entryFree>
bucetum: <entryFree id="n5799" type="main" key="bu_ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcētum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">būcīta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=164" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 164</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pasture for cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cow-pasture</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucina: <entryFree id="n5800" type="greek" key="bu_ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĭna</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">buccĭna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">buka/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n5800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crooked horn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trumpet</hi> (while tuba is usually the straight trumpet; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 5</bibl> Stewech.). </sense><sense id="n5800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucina inflata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:23:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 10, 29.—</sense><sense id="n5800.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5800.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A war-trumpet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello dat signum rauca cruentum Bucina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā bucina signum Dira dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 519</bibl></cit>.—In gen., as a signal employed in changing the four night-watches, and for waking the soldiers (cf. Dict. of Antiq.): <cit><quote lang="la">te gallorum, illum bucinarum cantus exsuscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi secundae vigiliae bucinā datum signum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:154" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5800.4" n="2" level="3"> Hence, meton.: ad primam, secundam, etc., bucinam (for vigiliam), <hi rend="ital">at the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad tertiam bucinam praesto essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—It was also blown at the end of the evening meal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl> Nipp. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n5800.5" n="B" level="2"> In other spheres of life; <cit><quote lang="la">so for calling assemblies of the people: bucina datur: homines ex agris concurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucina cogebat priscos ad verba Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">For designating the hours of the day (which were divided into four parts),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 799" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 799</bibl></cit>; cf. bucino.—</sense><sense id="n5800.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of circular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding shell on which Triton blew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Triton</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 335</bibl> and 337; cf. bucinator.—</sense><sense id="n5800.7" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedae bucina famae,</quote> <trans><tr>the trump of ill fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 152</bibl></cit>; cf. bucinator, II.</sense></entryFree>
bucinator: <entryFree id="n5801" type="main" key="bu_ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĭnātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bucc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bucino</etym>, <sense id="n5801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who blew the</hi> bucina, <hi rend="ital">a trumpeter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B.C. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3522</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5801.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. bucina, II. D.), <hi rend="ital">one who trumpets forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blazes abroad</hi>: bucinator existimationis meae, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucinna: <entryFree id="n5802" type="main" key="Bucinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bucinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island near Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucino: <entryFree id="n5803" type="main" key="bu_ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bucc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bucina</etym>, <sense id="n5803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow the</hi> bucina, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give a signal with the trumpet</hi> (mostly <hi rend="ital">impers.;</hi> cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">salpi/zein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum bucinatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe declamante illo ter bucinavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucinate in neomeniā tubā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 81</bibl></cit> (80), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Triton conchā sonaci leniter bucinat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. bucina, II. C.</sense></entryFree>
bucinum: <entryFree id="n5804" type="main" key="bu_ci^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĭnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bucc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n5804.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blast of a trumpet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 10, 10, § 20</bibl>.—Hence, ad Bucinum, <hi rend="ital">a quarter in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5804.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shell-fish used in dyeing purple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:129 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 61, § 129 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
bucinus: <entryFree id="n5805" type="hapax" key="bu_ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bucc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = bucinator, <sense id="n5805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trumpeter;</hi> of the cock, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucolicus: <entryFree id="n5806" type="greek" key="bu_co^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">boukoliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to shepherds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pastoral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bucolic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5806.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Bucolicōn poëma, <hi rend="ital">Virgil</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s pastoral poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Bucolics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 8</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcŏlĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\</foreign> <cb n="BULE" /> <foreign lang="greek">*boukolika/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Bucolics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:538" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bucolica Theocriti et Vergilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E.1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5806.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5806.3" n="A" level="2"> Bucolice tome = <foreign lang="greek">boukolikh\ tomh/</foreign>; in metre, <hi rend="ital">the bucolic cœsura; that of an hexameter whose fourth foot is a dactyl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ends a word</hi> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dic mihi, Damoeta, cujum pecus? an Meliboei?),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 88</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5806.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A species of</hi> panaces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 11, § 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5806.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcŏlĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a class of Egyptian soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from their place of abode</hi>, Bucolica, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. Phil. 21</bibl>; Vulcat. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 6, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucolium: <entryFree id="n5807" type="main" key="Bu_co^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būcŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bouko/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n5807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 16, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bucranium: <entryFree id="n5808" type="greek" key="bu_cra_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcrānĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boukra/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n5808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oxhead.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5808.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place of sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2322</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5808.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant like a bullock</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s head in shape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buculus: <entryFree id="n5809" type="main" key="bu_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būcŭlus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bōcŭlus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young bullock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 26</bibl>.—More freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n5809.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">būcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a young cow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a heifer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 375</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 86</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5809.2" n="B" level="2"> As a work of art, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl>. The statue of a brazen cow at Athens, the work of Myron, was especially distinguished, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buda: <entryFree id="n5810" type="main" key="buda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, colloq., = ulva, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 189, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 88:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 88, 6</bibl>; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 135</bibl>.</entryFree>
budalia: <entryFree id="n5811" type="main" key="Budalia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Budalia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lower Pannonia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
budini: <entryFree id="n5812" type="main" key="Bu_di_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būdīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Sarmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bufalus: <entryFree id="n5813" type="main" key="bu_fa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būfălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = bubalus, q. v.</entryFree>
bufo: <entryFree id="n5814" type="main" key="bu_fo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būfo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root bu-; cf. 2. bubo, bos</etym>, <sense id="n5814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a toad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bugillo: <entryFree id="n5815" type="main" key="bu_gillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būgillo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> ajuga reptans, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buglossa: <entryFree id="n5816" type="greek" key="bu_glossa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būglossa</orth> (bŭglossa, Aem. Mac. de Buglossa, 1 and 10), ae (<orth extent="full" lang="la">būglossŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 40, § 81</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/glwssos</foreign>, <sense id="n5816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oxtongue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bugloss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an herb</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 424</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bugonia: <entryFree id="n5817" type="greek" key="bu_go^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bougoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the generating of bees from the putrid carcasses of cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Archelaus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulapathum: <entryFree id="n5818" type="greek" key="bu_la^pa^thum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būlăpăthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boula/paqon</foreign>, <sense id="n5818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb patience</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 86, § 235</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bularchus: <entryFree id="n5819" type="main" key="Bu_larchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būlarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bou/larxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient Grecian painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 38, 39, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:55" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 8, 34, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulbaceus: <entryFree id="n5820" type="hapax" key="bulba_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulbācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. bulbus</etym>, <sense id="n5820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has bulbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulbous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyacinthi radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 26, 97, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bulbatio: <entryFree id="n5821" type="main" key="bulba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forming of bulbs</hi>, v. l. for bullatio, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
bulbine: <entryFree id="n5822" type="greek" key="bulbi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulbīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bolbi/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n5822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bulbous plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 41, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulbosus: <entryFree id="n5823" type="main" key="bulbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. bulbus</etym>, <sense id="n5823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bulbous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 90, § 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:102" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 17, 62, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulbulus: <entryFree id="n5824" type="main" key="bulbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bulb</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulbus: <entryFree id="n5825" type="main" key="bulbus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bulbŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">bolbo/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n5825.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bulb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulbous root</hi> (tulips, hyacinths, lilies, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 21, § 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 5, 11, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:67" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 32, § 67</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n5825.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An onion;</hi> a garden vegetable of several kinds, among which the Megarean was the best known, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 797</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:106" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:2" default="NO">4, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 93</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl>, and in Edict. Diocl. p. 16, called bulbus fabrilis.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5826" type="main" key="Bulbus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bulbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32, § 79</bibl>.—With a play on 1. bulbus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bule: <entryFree id="n5827" type="greek" key="bu_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boulh/</foreign>, <sense id="n5827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Greek</hi>) <hi rend="ital">council</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the senate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 116</bibl> (117), 1; 10, 81 (85), 1; 10, 110 (111), 1; 10, 112 (113), 1.</sense></entryFree>
buleuta: <entryFree id="n5828" type="greek" key="bu_leuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būleuta</orth>, ae. <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bouleuth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a councillor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a senātor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 39</bibl> (48), 5; 10, 112 (113), 3; 10, 114 (115), 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buleuterium: <entryFree id="n5829" type="greek" key="bu_leute_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būleutērĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bouleuth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n5829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where the Greek senate assembled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the senate-house</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in curiā Syracusis, quem locum illi buleuterium nomine appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyzici et buleuterion vocant aedificium amplum sine ferreo clavo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 100</bibl></cit>. <pb n="255" /> <cb n="BULL" /></sense></entryFree>
bulga: <entryFree id="n5830" type="foreign" key="bulga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gallic; now bougette</etym>, <sense id="n5830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leathern knapsack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bag</hi>: bulgas Galli sacculos scorteos appellant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.: bulga est folliculus omnis, quam et crumenam veteres appellarunt: et est sacculus ad bracchium pendens, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 78</bibl> (Sat. 2, 16, and 6, 1); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 78, 2</bibl> (Sat. Men. 61, 3).—</sense><sense id="n5830.1" n="II" level="1"> Humorously, <hi rend="ital">the womb</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 78, 14</bibl> (Sat. 26, 36).</sense></entryFree>
bulimio: <entryFree id="n5831" type="main" key="Bu_li_mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būlīmĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 125, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulimo: <entryFree id="n5832" type="main" key="bu_li_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būlīmo</orth>, <itype>āre, āvi, ātum</itype> (<foreign lang="greek">boulimiw=</foreign>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n5832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have bulimy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insatiable hunger</hi>, Pelag. Vet. 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bulimosus: <entryFree id="n5833" type="main" key="bu_li_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būlīmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bulimus</etym>, <sense id="n5833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with insatiable hunger</hi>, Pelag. Vet. 10.</sense></entryFree>
bulimus: <entryFree id="n5834" type="greek" key="bu_li_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būlīmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/limos</foreign>, <sense id="n5834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great hunger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulimy;</hi> hence also, <hi rend="ital">weakness of the stomach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fainting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 9</bibl>; cf. bu; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 34</bibl> (3, 35); 5, 37 (3, 38) (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl>, written as Greek).—Also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">būlī-ma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
bulla: <entryFree id="n5835" type="main" key="bulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root vhal-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fal-</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">fallo/s, fu/llon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any object swelling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thus becoming round;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n5835.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A waterbubble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bubble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pluvio perlucida caelo Surgere bulla solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 8, § 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5835.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bubble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifle; vanity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est homo bulla, eo magis senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5835.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing rounded by art.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5835.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A boss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knob</hi> (upon a door, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">jussine in splendorem dari bullas has foribus nostris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bullas aureas ex valvis, auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl></cit> (by such door-studs fortunate or unfortunate days were designated, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 4</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n5835.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stud</hi> in a girdle: <cit><quote lang="la">notis fulserunt cingula bullis Pallantis pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 942</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 359</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Cup. Cruc. 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 476</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5835.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The head of a pin in the water-clock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6, 9 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5835.7" n="III" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the</hi> bulla, <hi rend="ital">a kind of amulet worn upon the neck</hi> (<hi rend="ital">mostly of gold</hi>), orig. an ornament of the Roman triumphers, in imitation of the Tuscan kings and Lucumones (Plut. Romul. 25; <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. s. v. sardi, p. 252), but in the more brilliant era of the Romans worn by noble youths,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 152</bibl></cit> (cf. Ascon. in h. l., acc. to whom bullae of leather were hung upon the necks of the children of freedmen); <cit><quote lang="la">it was laid aside when they arrived at maturity, and consecrated to the Lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lares bullati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 60, 8</bibl></cit>; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 10</bibl>, first hung by Tarquinius Priscus upon the neck of his son; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 9</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 131; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 24</bibl>.—From the Etruscan custom, called Etruscum aurum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:163" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 163</bibl>.—Hence the phrase bullā dignus for <hi rend="ital">childish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senior bullā dignissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 33</bibl></cit>.—It was also hung upon the forehead of favorite animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bullatio: <entryFree id="n5836" type="main" key="bulla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bullo</etym>, <sense id="n5836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bubbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming of pebbles</hi>, of a stone found in small detached fragments: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa bullatio magnetis (opp. cautes continua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 42, § 148</bibl></cit> Sill. and Jan. (al. bulbatio).</sense></entryFree>
bullatus: <entryFree id="n5837" type="main" key="bulla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bulla</etym>. <sense id="n5837.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to bulla, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Quickly passing;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bombastic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5837.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to bulla, II.) <hi rend="ital">Furnished with a boss</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 116</bibl></cit> Müll.—Of the heavens, <hi rend="ital">studded with stars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, p. 24</bibl></cit> Munck. —</sense><sense id="n5837.2" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to bulla, III.) <hi rend="ital">Wearing a</hi> bulla <hi rend="ital">about the neck</hi>: puer, Scip. Afr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <trans><tr>of a child</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <trans><tr>yet a child</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 60, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bullesco: <entryFree id="n5838" type="main" key="bullesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n5838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [bullo], <hi rend="ital">to bubble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form bubbles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:8" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bullidenses: <entryFree id="n5839" type="main" key="Bulli^denses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bullĭdenses, -ienses</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-īni</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-iōnes</orth>, v. Bylli-.</entryFree>
bullio: <entryFree id="n5840" type="main" key="bulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. bullo.</entryFree>
