bullitus: <entryFree id="n5841" type="hapax" key="bulli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bullio</etym>, <sense id="n5841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bubbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gushing up of water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bullo: <entryFree id="n5842" type="main" key="bullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bulla</etym>, <sense id="n5842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in bubbling motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in a state of ebullition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bubble.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5842.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form bullo, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi bullabit vinum, ignem subducito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 31</bibl>, <cb n="BURI" /> 74, § 317.—</sense><sense id="n5842.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form bullio, īre: <cit><quote lang="la">bullientes fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:34" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:119" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:212" default="NO">6, 212</bibl>.—As <pos>v. a.</pos> in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: ammoniacum cum vino et melle mittis in ollam et bullita (<hi rend="ital">sodden</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">half-cooked</hi>) atteres, dabisque ad bibendum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl> (1, 45, 5).—</sense><sense id="n5842.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatione,</quote> <trans><tr>to boil with rage</tr>, <tr>fty in a passion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum incendio bulliebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Eustach. p. 236, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bullula: <entryFree id="n5843" type="main" key="bullu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bullŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>bulla</etym>. <sense id="n5843.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A watery vesicle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28</bibl>, n. 17.—</sense><sense id="n5843.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small neck-ornament</hi> (bulla), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 2, 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bumammus: <entryFree id="n5844" type="main" key="bu_mammus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būmammus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bu-mamma, having large breasts</etym>, of the vine, <sense id="n5844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with large clusters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bumastus: <entryFree id="n5845" type="greek" key="bu_mastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būmastus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">būmasta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, Edict. Diocl. p. 18), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/mastos</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">a)/mpelos</foreign> (having large breasts; cf. <sense id="n5845.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">bumammus),</quote> <trans><tr>a species of grape with large clusters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 102</bibl></cit> and Serv. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tument mammarum modo bumasti (acini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bumelia: <entryFree id="n5846" type="greek" key="bu_me^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būmĕlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boumeli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ash-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 13, 24, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bunias: <entryFree id="n5847" type="greek" key="bu_ni^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būnĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bounia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Swedish turnip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:422" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 422</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> buniada, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 11, § 21</bibl>.—Another kind is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">būnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/nion</foreign>, Plin. l. l.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">būnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">made from bunion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:52" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bupaeda: <entryFree id="n5848" type="main" key="bu_paeda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būpaeda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">bou/pais</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a huge youth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 908</bibl> Kopp. (al. pubeda).</sense></entryFree>
bupalus: <entryFree id="n5849" type="main" key="Bu_pa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būpălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bou/palos</foreign>, <sense id="n5849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a statuary of Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who represented and exposed the deformed poet Hipponax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but in turn was severely satirized by him in his poems</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buphthalmos: <entryFree id="n5850" type="greek" key="bu_phthalmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būphthalmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/fqalmos</foreign>. <sense id="n5850.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Oxeye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 42, § 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5850.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of</hi> aizoon majus, <hi rend="ital">houseleek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bupleuron: <entryFree id="n5851" type="greek" key="bu_pleuron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būpleuron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/pleuron</foreign>, <sense id="n5851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an umbelliferous plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hare</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-ear</hi>: Bupleurum baldense, Host.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 35, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buprestis: <entryFree id="n5852" type="greek" key="bu_prestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būprestis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/prhstis (prh/qw</foreign>, to swell up). <sense id="n5852.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A venomous beetle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose sting caused a swelling in cattle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:119" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 10, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 77, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 3, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5852.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of vegetable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 36, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bura: <entryFree id="n5853" type="main" key="bu_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. buris.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5854" type="main" key="Bu_ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Achaia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burdo: <entryFree id="n5855" type="foreign" key="burdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">burdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 7</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign />, <sense id="n5855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mule</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the offspring of a horse and she-ass</hi>, while mulus is the offspring of an ass and a mare; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 1, 61</bibl>), esp. used for carrying litters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus duorum burdonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
burdonarius: <entryFree id="n5856" type="main" key="burdo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burdōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>burdo</etym>, <sense id="n5856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a muledriver</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 19.</sense></entryFree>
burdunculus: <entryFree id="n5857" type="main" key="burduncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burduncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">borage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burgarii: <entryFree id="n5858" type="main" key="burga_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burgārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>burgus</etym>, <sense id="n5858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhabitants of a castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defenders of the borders</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 7, 14, 1; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burgundiones: <entryFree id="n5859" type="main" key="Burgundi^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Burgundĭōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bur-gundĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe of Goths</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided into the East Burgundians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who dwelt between the Oder and the Vistula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the West Burgundians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the upper Main.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5859.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form Burgundiones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> I. Pan. 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5859.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form Burgundii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 5, 9</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> II. Pan. 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Burgundĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Burgundian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 234</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Burgundiones equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
burgus: <entryFree id="n5860" type="foreign" key="burgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">pu/rgos</foreign>; Germ. Burg, Berg; Engl. -burg, borough, -bury</etym>, <sense id="n5860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">castellum parvulum, quem burgum vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra per limites habitacula constituta burgos vulgo vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2, § 4</bibl>; Cod. Th. 12, 19, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buri: <entryFree id="n5861" type="main" key="Buri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Buri</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Burii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bouroi/</foreign>, <sense id="n5861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people in the neighborhood of the Marcomanni and Quadi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> <cb n="BUST" /></sense></entryFree>
buris: <entryFree id="n5862" type="main" key="bu_ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">būra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 19, 2</bibl>) [acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 170</bibl> (cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 14, 2</bibl>), contr. from <foreign lang="greek">bou=s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">ou)ra/</foreign>, ox-tail], <sense id="n5862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the curved hinder part of the plough of the ancients</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the plough-beam</hi>, Varr. ap. Serv. l. l.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> burim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 170</bibl> Serv. and Voss.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5863" type="main" key="Bu_ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Achaia; acc.</hi> Burin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 293</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burius: <entryFree id="n5864" type="main" key="buri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of animal</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:31" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burra: <entryFree id="n5865" type="main" key="burra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>burrus</etym>. <sense id="n5865.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small cow with a red mouth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">muzzle</hi>, acc. to Fest. s. v.—</sense><sense id="n5865.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shaggy garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 133, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">burrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nonsense</hi> (post-class.): burras, quisquilias, ineptiasque, etc., Aus. praef. ad Latin. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burranica: <entryFree id="n5866" type="gloss" key="burra_ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burrānĭca pōtio</orth> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink composed of milk and must</hi>, so called on account of its red color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:780" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 780</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burranicum: <entryFree id="n5867" type="gloss" key="burra_ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burrānĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prob. formed from the preced.</etym>, <sense id="n5867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vessel</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 36</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
burrhinon: <entryFree id="n5868" type="greek" key="burrhi^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burrhĭnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">bou=s-r(i/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oxnose</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burricus: <entryFree id="n5869" type="main" key="burri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burrĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">būrĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-chus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>burrus; Fr. bourrique</etym>, <sense id="n5869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small horse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 29</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Varr. R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
burrus: <entryFree id="n5870" type="gloss" key="burrus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">burrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym><foreign lang="greek">purro/s</foreign></etym>, an old word, = rufus, rubens, <sense id="n5870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 31</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 36</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">byrrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:283" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 283</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5871" type="main" key="Burrus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Burrus</orth>, <itype>an old form for Pyrrhus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 15</bibl>.</entryFree>
bursaonenses: <entryFree id="n5872" type="main" key="Bursa^o_nenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bursăōnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bursăvōnenses</orth>, Auct. B. Hisp. 22: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bursăōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, Liv. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 91</bibl>, Fragm. 20 Weissenb.</sense></entryFree>
buselinum: <entryFree id="n5873" type="greek" key="bu_se^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būsĕlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bouse/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n5873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ox-parsley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 47, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
busequa: <entryFree id="n5874" type="main" key="bu_se^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būsĕqua</orth>, v. bubsequa.</entryFree>
busiris: <entryFree id="n5875" type="main" key="Bu_si_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būsīris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype> (ĭdis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 5</bibl>; <sense id="n5875.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ìdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 155</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> Busiridem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 31" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:56" default="NO">56</bibl>; Serv.ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 300</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Busirin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 649</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Busirim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 46</bibl></cit>), = <foreign lang="greek">*bou/si=ris</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n5875.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a king of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who sacrificed strangers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was himself slain by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 5</bibl>; Mythogr. Lat. 1, 65; 2, 157; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5875.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a considerable town in Lower Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Isis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Abousir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 64</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5875.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A village near the Great Pyramid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 16, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bustar: <entryFree id="n5876" type="gloss" key="bustar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bustar</orth>, <itype>aris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bustum</etym>, <sense id="n5876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where dead bodies were burned</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 25</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
busticetum: <entryFree id="n5877" type="main" key="busti^ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bustĭcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, post-class. for bustum, <sense id="n5877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where dead bodies were burned</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 222.</sense></entryFree>
bustirapus: <entryFree id="n5878" type="hapax" key="busti^ra^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bustĭrăpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bustum-rapio</etym>, <sense id="n5878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber of tombs</hi>, a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">impudice, sceleste, verbero, bustirape, furcifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bustualis: <entryFree id="n5879" type="main" key="bustua_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bustuālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bustum</etym>, <sense id="n5879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the place where dead bodies were burned</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bustuarius: <entryFree id="n5880" type="main" key="bustu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bustŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the place where dead bodies were burned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiator,</quote> <trans><tr>that fought at a funeral pile in honor of the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 519</bibl> (Cicero so calls Clodius, in the passage cited, on account of a tumult which he caused at the funeral ceremonies that Cicero's brother made in honor of Marius): <cit><quote lang="la">moecha,</quote> <trans><tr>she who prostitutes herself among tombs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altare,</quote> <trans><tr>upon which men were offered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latro = bustirapus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bustum: <entryFree id="n5881" type="main" key="bustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>buro = uro, whence also comburo; cf. burrus, red</etym>, orig. <sense id="n5881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where the bodies of the dead were burned and buried;</hi> later also, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">a tomb</hi>: bustum proprie dicitur locus, in quo mortuus est combustus et sepultus... ubi vero combustus quis tantummodo, alibi vero est sepultus, is locus ab urendo ustrina vocatur; sed modo busta sepulchra appellamus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.; cf. Serv. ad Verg. <pb n="256" /> <cb n="BUXA" /> A. 3, 22; 11, 201; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1514, 3</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n5881.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The place of burning and burying; the funeral-pyre after the burning of the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiustaque servant Busta neque avelli possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 201</bibl></cit> Don. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 906</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:226" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 226</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5881.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5881.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a mound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tomb</hi> (most freq. in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">in busto Achilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: si quis bustum (nam id puto appellari <foreign lang="greek">tu/mbon</foreign>) violarit, Solon ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 850</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 863</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 6, 29; 1, 19, 21; 2 (3), 13, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 452 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 33, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 748</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n5881.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things that, like a tomb, give up a body to destruction; so of <hi rend="ital">the maw of an animal that eats men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viva videns vivo sepeliri viscera busto,</quote> <trans><tr>seeing the living body enclosed in the living grave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:991" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 991</bibl></cit>.—So of Tereus, who devoured his son: <cit><quote lang="la">flet modo, seque vocat bustum miserabile nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 665</bibl></cit>.—Sarcastically, of one who annulled the laws: <cit><quote lang="la">bustum legum omnium ac religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">bustum rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a battle-field</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilia busta Philippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit> Kuin.—</sense><sense id="n5881.5" n="B" level="2"> Ad Busta Gallica, <hi rend="ital">a place in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from the Gauls who were burned and buried there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=157" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 157</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5881.6" n="C" level="2"> Of a destroyed city, <hi rend="ital">the site</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 17, 15, § 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5881.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The burned body itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ashes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:247" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buteo: <entryFree id="n5882" type="main" key="bu_te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būtĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of falcon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hawk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:263" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 280</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 32</bibl> Müll.; giving auguries by its flight, v. ales, II. E.</sense></entryFree>
butes: <entryFree id="n5883" type="main" key="Bu_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Buten, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 372</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 647</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 690</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 500</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bou/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n5883.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Amycus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Bebrycians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Dares at the tomb of Hector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 372</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5883.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Argonaut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Teleon and Zeuxippe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5883.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of the Athenian Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sent with Cephalus to Æacus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 500</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5883.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An armor-bearer of Anchises</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 647</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n5883.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 690</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
buthrotum: <entryFree id="n5884" type="main" key="Bu_thro_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būthrōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Būthrōtŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 721</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*bouqrwto/n</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*bouqrwto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the coast of Epirus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Butrinto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:293 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 293 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būthrōtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Buthrotum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager, causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Plancus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būthrōtĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Buthrotum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 11, 2</bibl>; 15, 2, 2; 16, 16, A, 4.</sense></entryFree>
buthysia: <entryFree id="n5885" type="greek" key="bu_thy^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būthysĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bouqusi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrifice of oxen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
buticus: <entryFree id="n5886" type="main" key="Bu_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būtĭcus</orth>, v. Butos.</entryFree>
butio: <entryFree id="n5887" type="main" key="bu_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bittern</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 42.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n5888" type="main" key="buti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">butĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. 2. bubo.</entryFree>
butoa: <entryFree id="n5889" type="main" key="Bu_to^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būtŏa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island near Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
butoridas: <entryFree id="n5890" type="main" key="Bu_to^ri^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būtŏrĭdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boutori/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n5890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek writer on the Pyramids of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
butos: <entryFree id="n5891" type="main" key="Bu_to^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Būtŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bou=tos</foreign>, <sense id="n5891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief city of the</hi> nomos Ptenethu <hi rend="ital">in Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the Sebennytic mouth of the Nile; containing a famous temple and oracle of Latona</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Buto</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 64</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Būtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Butos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
butrotus: <entryFree id="n5892" type="main" key="Butro_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Butrōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Bruttia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Bruciano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buttuti: <entryFree id="n5893" type="main" key="buttuti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buttuti</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 216</bibl> P.</entryFree>
butubatta: <entryFree id="n5894" type="main" key="bu^tu^batta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭtŭbatta</orth> = nugatoria, <sense id="n5894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless things</hi>, Naev. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 36</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 25 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, 16, p. 216</bibl> P.; cf. Comment. p. 351 sq.</sense></entryFree>
butuntum: <entryFree id="n5895" type="main" key="Butuntum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Butuntum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Calabria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bitonte;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Butuntinenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Butuntum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. p. 111" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. p. 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
butyrum: <entryFree id="n5896" type="greek" key="bu_ty_^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">būtȳ^rum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ȳ</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 12, 7</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŭ-tyron</orth>, Aen. Mac. Herb. c. de ruta. buturum, Edict. Diocl. p. 15), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bou/turon</foreign> [said to be a Scythian word, but prob. <foreign lang="greek">bou=sturo/s</foreign>; <sense id="n5896.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Engl. butter],</quote> <trans><tr>butter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:133" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 35, § 133</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
buxans: <entryFree id="n5897" type="main" key="buxans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>buxus</etym>, <sense id="n5897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the color of boxwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 5</bibl></cit>; p. 180 Bip. <cb n="BYSS" /></sense></entryFree>
buxentum: <entryFree id="n5898" type="main" key="Buxentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Buxentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pucou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n5898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Greek origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colonized by the Romans after the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 45, 2</bibl>; now <hi rend="ital">Policastro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 23, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5898.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5898.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Buxentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Buxentum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 90" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5898.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Buxen-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:585" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 585</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
buxetum: <entryFree id="n5899" type="main" key="buxe_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>buxus</etym>, <sense id="n5899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation of boxwood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 14, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
buxeus: <entryFree id="n5900" type="main" key="buxe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n5900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the boxwood-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of boxwood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boxwood-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5900.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of boxwood</hi>: rostra (anatum), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 460, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:41:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: anuli, perh. ironic. for <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi> (on account of the paleness of boxwood), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pallor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 231, 4.</sense></entryFree>
buxifer: <entryFree id="n5901" type="hapax" key="buxi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>buxus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n5901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing box-trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cytorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
buxosus: <entryFree id="n5902" type="hapax" key="buxo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>buxus</etym>, <sense id="n5902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like boxwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">xylobalsamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
buxum: <entryFree id="n5903" type="main" key="buxum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wood of the boxtree</hi> (cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 509; 1, 625). </sense><sense id="n5903.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">torno rasile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora buxo Pallidiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multifori tibia buxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxoque simillimus Pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:417" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 417</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5903.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. of objects made of boxwood. </sense><sense id="n5903.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A flute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflati murmur buxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terebratum per rara foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:697" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 697</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava buxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 42: <cit><quote lang="la">ad inspirata rotari Buxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:171" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 688" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 688</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5903.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A top</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxum torquere flagello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5903.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A comb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines depectere buxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:229" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput intactum buxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5903.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A writingtablet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 23, 8; Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5903.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = buxus, <hi rend="ital">the boxtree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
buxus: <entryFree id="n5904" type="greek" key="buxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">buxus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/cos</foreign> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 549</bibl>, and the letter B). <sense id="n5904.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evergreen box-tree</hi>, Enn. ap. Phylarg. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus densa foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crispata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuo virens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 230</bibl>; for its natural history, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5904.1" n="II" level="1"> For <hi rend="ital">things made of boxwood</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 172</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>: tympana vos buxasque vocant Berecyntia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 619</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 480</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

c: <entryFree id="n5918" type="main" key="C"><orth extent="full" lang="la">C</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">c</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, or <gen>f.</gen>, the third letter of the Latin alphabet; corresponded originally in sound to the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*g</foreign> (which in inscrr., esp. in the Doric, was frequently written like the Latin C; v. O. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 295); hence the old orthography: LECIONES, MACISTRATOS, EXFOCIONT, [pu]CNANDOD, PVC[nad], CARTACINIENSI, upon the Columna rostrata, for legiones, magistratos, effugiunt, pugnando, pugnā, Carthaginiensi; and the prænomina Gaius and Gnaeus, even to the latest times, were designated by C. and Cn., while Caeso or Kaeso was written with K; cf. the letter G. Still, even as early as the time of the kings, whether through the influence of the Tuscans, among whom <foreign lang="greek">*g</foreign> sounded like K, or of the. Sabines, whose language was kindred with that of the Tuscans, the C seems to have been substituted for K; hence even Consul was designated by Cos., and K remained in use only before <sense id="n5918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi>, as in Kalendae; k. k. for calumniae causā, INTERKAL for intercalaris, MERK for mercatus, and in a few other republican inscrr., because by this vowel K was distinguished from Q, as in Gr. Kappa from Koppa, and in Phœnician Caph from Cuph, while C was employed like other consonants with <hi rend="ital">e.</hi> Q was used at the beginning of words only when <hi rend="ital">u</hi>, pronounced like <hi rend="ital">v</hi>, followed, as Quirites from Cures, Tanaquil from Thanchufil, Thanchfil, <foreign lang="greek">*qankvil</foreign>; accordingly, C everywhere took the place of Q, when that accompanying labial sound was lost, or <hi rend="ital">u</hi> was used as a vowel; so in the gentile name of Maecenas Cilnius, from the Etrusk. Cvelne or Cfelne (O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 414 sq.); so in coctus, cocus, alicubi, sicubi; in relicŭŭs (four syl.) for reliquus (trisyl.): AECETIA = AEQITIA, i. q. aequitas (V. AECETIA), etc., and as in the Golden Age cujus was written for quojus, and cui for quoi (corresponding to cum for quom); thus, even in the most ancient period, quor or cur was used together with <pb n="257" /> <cb n="C" /> quare, cura with quaero, curia with Quiris, as inversely inquilinus with incola, and in S. C. Bacch. OQVOLTOD = occulto. Hence, at the end of words que, as well as ce in hic, sic, istic, illic, was changed to <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, as in ac for atque, nec for neque, nunc, tunc, donec for numque, tumque, dumque; and in the middle of words it might also pass into <hi rend="ital">g.</hi> as in negotium and neglego, cf. necopinus. Since C thus gradually took the place of K and Q, with the single exception that our <hi rend="ital">kw</hi> was throughout designated by <hi rend="ital">qu</hi>, it was strange that under the emperors grammarians began again to write <hi rend="ital">k</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">c</hi> before <hi rend="ital">a</hi>, though even <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>, expressed his displeasure at this; and they afterwards wrote <hi rend="ital">q</hi> before <hi rend="ital">u</hi>, even when no labial sound followed, as in pequnia, or merely peqnia, for pecunia; cf. the letters Q and U. About the beginning of the sixth century of the city the modified form G was introduced for the flat guttural sound, and C thenceforth regularly represented the hard sound = our K. The use of aspirates was unknown to the Romans during the first six centuries, hence the letter C also represents the Gr. X, as BACA and BACANALIBVS, for Baccha and Bacchanalibus (the single C instead of the double, as regularly in the most ancient times); cf. also <foreign lang="greek">sxi/zw</foreign> with scindo, and <foreign lang="greek">polu/xroos</foreign> with pulcer. But even in the time of Cicero scheda came into use for scida, and pulcher for pulcer; so also the name of the Gracchi was aspirated, as were the name Cethegus and the word triumphus, which, however, in the song of the Arval brothers, is TRIVMPVS; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>, and the letter P. About this time the use of aspirates became so common, in imitation of Greek, that Catullus wrote upon it an epigram (84), which begins with the words: <hi rend="ital">Cho</hi>mmoda dicebat, si quando commoda vellet; and in Monum. Ancyr. inchoo is used for the orig. incoho, acc. to which the ancient Romans also employed cohors for chors (v. cohors).On account of the near relationship of <hi rend="ital">c</hi> and <hi rend="ital">g</hi>, as given above, they are very often interchanged, esp. when connected with liquids: Cygnus, Progne, Gnidus, Gnossus, from <foreign lang="greek">ku/knos, *pro/knh, *kni/dos, *knwsso/s</foreign> (even when <hi rend="ital">n</hi> was separated from <hi rend="ital">c</hi> by a vowel, as in Saguntum for <foreign lang="greek">*za/kunqos</foreign>, or absorbed by an <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, as in vigesimus and trigesimus for vicensimus and tricensimus); mulgeo for mulceo, segmen from seco, gummi for commi (<foreign lang="greek">ko/mmi</foreign>); gurgulio for curculio, grabatus for <foreign lang="greek">kra/batos</foreign>, so that amurca was also written for amurga, from <foreign lang="greek">a)mo/rgh</foreign>, as inversely conger for gonger, from <foreign lang="greek">go/ggros</foreign>; but also with other letters; cf. mastruca and mastruga, misceo and <foreign lang="greek">mi/sgw</foreign>, mugio and <foreign lang="greek">muka/omai</foreign>, gobius and <foreign lang="greek">kwbio/s</foreign>, gubernator and <foreign lang="greek">kubernh/ths</foreign>. Not less freq. is the interchange of <hi rend="ital">c</hi> and <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, which is noticed by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Inst. 1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Inst. 1, 11, 5</bibl>, and in accordance with which, in composition, <hi rend="ital">d</hi> or <hi rend="ital">t</hi> before <hi rend="ital">qu</hi>, except with <hi rend="ital">que</hi>, became <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, as acquiro, nequicquam, iccirco for idcirco, ecquis for etquis, etc. Hence is explained the rejection of <hi rend="ital">c</hi> before <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, as in Lutatius for Luctatius, and the arbitrariness with which many names were written with <hi rend="ital">cc</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tt</hi> for <hi rend="ital">ct</hi>, as Vettones for Vectones; Nacca or Natta for Nacta (from the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gna/ptw</foreign>). It would be erroneouś to infer, from the varied orthography of the names' Accius, Attius, and Actius, or Peccius, Pettius, and Pectius, a hissing pronunciation of them; for as the Romans interchange the terminations <hi rend="ital">icius</hi> and <hi rend="ital">itius</hi>, and the orthography fetialis and fecialis, indutiae and induciae, with one another, they also wrote Basculi or Bastuli, anclare or antlare, etc. <hi rend="ital">Ci</hi> for <hi rend="ital">ti</hi> does not appear till an African inscr. of the third century after Christ, and not often before Gallic inscrr. and documents of the seventh century; <hi rend="ital">ti</hi> for <hi rend="ital">ci</hi> is not certainly found before the end of the fourth century; and <hi rend="ital">ci</hi> before a vowel does not appear to have been pronounced as <hi rend="ital">sh</hi>, except provincially, before the sixth or seventh century; cf. Roby, Gr. bk. 1, ch. 7; and so in gen., Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 33 sqq. C is sometimes interchanged with <hi rend="ital">p</hi>: columba, palumbes; coquus, popa, popina (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/teros</foreign>; Sanscr. katara; <foreign lang="greek">po/teros</foreign>; Lat. uter). C is sometimes dropped in the middle of a word: luna for luc-na, <cb n="CACA" /> lumen for luc-men; so also at the beginning of a word: uter for cuter; Sanscr. katara, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>.As an abbreviation, C designates Gaius, and reversed, O, Gaia; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl>. As a numeral, C = centum, and upon voting tablets = condemno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Div. in Caecil. 7:24" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl>; cf. the letter A <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence it is called littera tristis (opp. A = absolvo, which is called littera salutaris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit> Moeb.</sense></entryFree>
caballa: <entryFree id="n5919" type="main" key="ca^balla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caballus</etym>, <sense id="n5919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mare</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> I. p. 628</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
caballarius: <entryFree id="n5920" type="gloss" key="ca^balla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/lhs, i/ppeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horseman</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.: <foreign lang="greek">i/ppoko/mos</foreign> (i.e. <hi rend="ital">a hostler</hi>) caballarius, Gloss. Vet.; hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">cavaliero</hi>, Fr. <hi rend="ital">chevalier.</hi></sense></entryFree>
caballatio: <entryFree id="n5921" type="main" key="ca^balla_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fodder for a horse</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 7, 4, 34; 12, 38, 14.</sense></entryFree>
caballinus: <entryFree id="n5922" type="main" key="ca^balli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horse.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 20, 81, § 265</bibl></cit>. dentes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 72</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">flmum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 38, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Hippocrene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caballio: <entryFree id="n5923" type="main" key="ca^balli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marini, perh. = hippocampi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caballion: <entryFree id="n5924" type="main" key="ca^balli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> cynoglossa, <hi rend="ital">hartstongue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spleenwort</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caballus: <entryFree id="n5925" type="greek" key="ca^ballus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căballus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaba/llhs</foreign> [perh. Celtic; hence Ital. cavallo, Fr. cheval, Engl. cavalry, cavalier, etc.; cf. cob, Germ. Gaul], <sense id="n5925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior riding-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pack-horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a nag</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): tardus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Varr. ib.: mediā de nocte caballum Arripit,</quote> <trans><tr>his nag</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 88</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:195" default="NO">11, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgoneus, jestingly for Pegasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5925.1" n="B" level="2"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n5925.2" n="1" level="3"> Optat ephippia bos piger, optat arare caballus, i.e. <hi rend="ital">no one is content with his own condition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5925.3" n="2" level="3"> Tamquam caballus in clivo, for <hi rend="ital">one who walks wearily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 2</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 394</bibl>: principio clivi noster anhelat equus).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5926" type="main" key="Ca^ballus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căballus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, in the pun: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Galbam salibus tuis, et ipsum Possis vincere Sextium Caballum. Non cuicumque datum est habere nasum. Ludit qui stolidā procacitate, non est Sextius ille, sed caballus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cabillonum: <entryFree id="n5927" type="main" key="Ca^billo_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căbillōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kabulli=non</foreign>, <sense id="n5927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a considerable town of. the Ædui in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, now <hi rend="ital">Chalons sur Saōne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 90</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căbillōnen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Cabillonum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cabira: <entryFree id="n5928" type="main" key="Cabi_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cabīra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *ka/beira</foreign>, <sense id="n5928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a residence of Mithridates</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cabiri: <entryFree id="n5929" type="main" key="Ca^bi_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căbīri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/beiroi</foreign> (v. Liddell and Scott, s.v.), <sense id="n5929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Cabiri</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deities worshipped by the Pelasgi as tutelary geniì</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in whose honor mysteries were celebrated at Lemnos and Samothrace; originally attendants of the great gods</hi> (dei magni and potes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 10, 18</bibl>); <hi rend="ital">they were afterwards identified with these</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the Dioscuri</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipped as guardian spirits</hi> (cf. Samothraces, s.v. Samothracia): celsa Cabirūm Delubra tenes, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 11</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 526 Rib.).—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cabiro patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cabus: <entryFree id="n5930" type="greek" key="ca^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = LXX. <foreign lang="greek">ka/bos</foreign> [Heb. kab], <sense id="n5930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corn-measure</hi>, answering to the <foreign lang="greek">xoi=nic</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 6, 25</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cabyle: <entryFree id="n5931" type="main" key="Ca^by^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căbylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-la</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căbylētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cabyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caca: <entryFree id="n5932" type="main" key="Ca_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sister of Cacus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacabaceus: <entryFree id="n5933" type="hapax" key="ca_ca^ba_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cācăbācĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cacc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cacabus</etym>, <sense id="n5933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a kitchen-pot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>like the liquid boiling in a pot</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cacabatus: <entryFree id="n5934" type="hapax" key="ca_ca^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cācăbātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cacc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmeared like a cooking-pot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia (opp. immaculata),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. ad Serv. 32, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cacabo: <entryFree id="n5935" type="main" key="ca_ca^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cācăbo</orth> ( [brevemacr][brevemacr] Auct. Fragm. Aucup. 12), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n5935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cackle;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kakkabi/zw</foreign>, as the natural cry of the partridge: cacabat hinc perdix, Carm. Philom. 19 <cb n="CACO" /></sense></entryFree>
cacabulus: <entryFree id="n5936" type="main" key="ca_ca^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cācăbŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cacc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cacabus</etym>, <sense id="n5936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cooking-pot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacabus: <entryFree id="n5937" type="greek" key="ca_ca^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cācăbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cacc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/kkabos</foreign>, <sense id="n5937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cooking-pot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas ubi coquebant cibum, ab eo caccabum appellarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:27:36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 27, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=3" default="NO">33, 7, 18, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 220" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacalia: <entryFree id="n5938" type="greek" key="ca^ca_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcālĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kakali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> leontice, acc. to Sprengel: Cacalia verbascifolia, Sibth.; acc. to Schneid. <hi rend="ital">colt</hi>'<hi rend="ital">sfoot</hi>, in pure Latin, tussilago, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 85, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:29" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 15, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacaturio: <entryFree id="n5939" type="hapax" key="ca^ca_tu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcātŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n5939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. desid.</hi> [caco], <hi rend="ital">to desire to go to stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacemphaton: <entryFree id="n5940" type="main" key="ca^cempha^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcemphăton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kake/mfaton</foreign>, <sense id="n5940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a low</hi> or <hi rend="ital">improper expression</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 83, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cachecta: <entryFree id="n5941" type="main" key="ca^checta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaxe/kths</foreign> (in bad physical condition), <sense id="n5941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that is in a consumption; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32</bibl>. 10, 39, § 117.</sense></entryFree>
cachecticus: <entryFree id="n5942" type="greek" key="ca^checti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchectĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaxekgiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hectic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consumptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cachectic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 39, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cachexia: <entryFree id="n5943" type="greek" key="ca^chexi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchexĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaxeci/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cachexy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6:80" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6, 80</bibl> sqq.; 4, 2, 18 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 32</bibl>, as Gr.).</sense></entryFree>
cachinnabilis: <entryFree id="n5944" type="main" key="ca^chinna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchinnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cachinno</etym> (Appuleian). <sense id="n5944.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Capable of laughing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laughing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo animal cachinnabile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 33, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5944.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to immoderate laughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cachinnatio: <entryFree id="n5945" type="main" key="ca^chinna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchinnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent laughing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate laughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā suspitione nimiae suspitionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si ridere concessum sit, vituperetur tamen cachinnatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cachinno: <entryFree id="n5946" type="main" key="ca^chinno1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchinno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>like <foreign lang="greek">kaxa/zw</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">kagxa/zw</foreign>; Sanscr. kakk; and our titter, onomatop.</etym>, <sense id="n5946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to laugh aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laugh immoderately.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5946.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class. but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">famulae furtim cachinnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:919" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 919</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:976" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 976</bibl>: ridere convivae; <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnare ipse Apronius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 28" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 28</bibl>.—With the <case>acc.</case> of that which one laughs at: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum meum cachinnant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n5946.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> (v. Liddell and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">kaxla/zw, ge/lws, ge/lasma</foreign>, and Blomfield. Aesch.
