Prom. 90) of the sea, <hi rend="ital">to plash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roar</hi>: suavisona echo crepitu clangente cachinnat, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 463, 16</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 572 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5947" type="hapax" key="ca^chinno2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchinno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. cachinno</etym>, <sense id="n5947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who laughs violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a laugher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derider</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kagxasth/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cachinnosus: <entryFree id="n5948" type="main" key="ca^chinnosus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchinnosus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cachinno</etym>, <sense id="n5948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to loud laughter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:41" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cachinnus: <entryFree id="n5949" type="main" key="ca^chinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căchinnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud laugh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate laughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a laugh in derision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a jeering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5949.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class in prose and poetry; also in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">tum dulces esse cachinni consuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1396</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo Alcibiades cachinnum dicitur sustulisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have set up a loud laugh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnos irridentium commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res digna tuo cachinno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:280" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:2" default="NO">11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:87" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusus in cachinnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnum edere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnos revocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 41</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n5949.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the sea (cf. 1, cachinno, II.), <hi rend="ital">a plashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rippling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leni resonant plangore cachinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 273</bibl></cit> (cf. Aesch. Prom. 90' <foreign lang="greek">ponti/wn te kuma/twn u)nh/riqmon ge/lasma</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
cachla: <entryFree id="n5950" type="greek" key="cachla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cachla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/xla</foreign>, <sense id="n5950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> buphthalmos, <hi rend="ital">oxeye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 42, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cachrys: <entryFree id="n5951" type="greek" key="cachrys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cachrys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/xrus (ka/gxrus</foreign>). <sense id="n5951.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An appendage to the catkin of certain trees in autumn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 11, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18</bibl>, n. 5; <cit><quote lang="la">admixta cachry,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 32, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:134" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 13, 109, § 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5951.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The capsule of rosemary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 60, § 101</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5951.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The white kernel of the plant</hi> crethmos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 50, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caco: <entryFree id="n5952" type="main" key="ca^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n5952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>,—<foreign lang="greek">kaka/w</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to go to stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at stool.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5952.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 2</bibl>: toto decies in <pb n="258" /> <cb n="CACU" /> anno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 20</bibl>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:61:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 61, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5952.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 1</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 209 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">canes odorem mixtum cum merdis cacant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:89" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 89</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to defile with excrement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacata charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 1</bibl></cit> and 20.</sense></entryFree>
cacoethes: <entryFree id="n5953" type="greek" key="ca^co^e_the^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏēthĕs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kako/hqes, to/</foreign> (bad state or habit); <sense id="n5953.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in medic. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>an obstinate</tr>, <tr>malignant disease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>, n 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> cacoëthe = <foreign lang="greek">kakoh/qh, ta/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 64, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:78" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 47, § 78</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n5953.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an incurable passion for writing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scribbling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanabile Scribendi cacoëthes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cacometer: <entryFree id="n5954" type="main" key="ca^co^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏmĕter</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏmĕtrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n5954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faulty in metre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmetrical</hi>, Juba ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Mer. Ter. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacomnemon: <entryFree id="n5955" type="main" key="Ca^comne_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căcomnēmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">title of a mime of Laberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacophaton: <entryFree id="n5956" type="main" key="ca^co^pha^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏphăton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a union of two or more disagreeable sounds which form an equivocal word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cacophony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacophonia: <entryFree id="n5957" type="main" key="ca^co^pho_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏphōnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kako/s-fwnh/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disagreeable sound formed by the meeting of syllables</hi> or <hi rend="ital">words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cacophong</hi>, Mod. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
cacosyntheton: <entryFree id="n5958" type="greek" key="ca^co^synthe^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏsynthĕton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kakosu/nqeton</foreign>; in rhet., <sense id="n5958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incorrect connection of words</hi> (as, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 610</bibl>): quod male collocatum, id <foreign lang="greek">kakosu/nqeton</foreign> Vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 59</bibl>; cf. Don. p. 1771 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 243</bibl> ib.; Serv. ad Verg. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 33, 12</bibl>; Lucil. ap. Vel. Long. p. 2214 P.</sense></entryFree>
cacozelia: <entryFree id="n5959" type="greek" key="ca^co^ze_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏzēlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kakozhli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward imitation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 73</bibl>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kako/zhlon</foreign>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl>); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 446</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
cacozelus: <entryFree id="n5960" type="greek" key="ca^co^ze_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŏzēlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kako/zhlos</foreign>, <sense id="n5960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bad imitator</hi> (cf. cacozelia), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Caecil. 6:21" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Caecil. 6, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
cactus: <entryFree id="n5961" type="greek" key="cactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cactus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/ktos</foreign>, <sense id="n5961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prickly plant with edible stalks</hi>, etc., found in Sicily, <hi rend="ital">Spanish artichoke</hi>: Cynara cardunculus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 57, § 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5961.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eradicato omni cacto et rubo subdolae familiaritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cacula: <entryFree id="n5962" type="main" key="ca^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŭla</orth> (cacula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:Arg. 2:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. Arg. 2, 13 sq.</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. cak-, to help; cf. calon; v. Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 45 Müll.; Fest. s. v. procalare, p. 225 ib.</etym>, <sense id="n5962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">the servant of a soldier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacula = servus militis (militaris? cf. the passage foll., from Plaut.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl></cit>: cacula <foreign lang="greek">dou=los stratiw/tou</foreign>, Gloss.: <cit><quote lang="la">video caculam militarem me futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3</bibl></cit>. 2, 98; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:Arg. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. Arg. 4</bibl>; and perh., acc. to the MSS., also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 61</bibl>, where Jahn reads casulis; cf. Weber, Juv. Excurs. in h. l.</sense></entryFree>
caculatum: <entryFree id="n5963" type="gloss" key="ca^cu^la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcŭlātum</orth> = servitium, <sense id="n5963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">servitude</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll. [cacula].</sense></entryFree>
cacumen: <entryFree id="n5964" type="main" key="ca^cu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n5964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extreme end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">point of a thing; the peak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utmost point.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5964.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (whether horizontal or perpendicular; while culmen is an extremity projecting in height; v. Doed. Syn.; in the poets freq.; in prose rare before the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ut altis Arboribus vicina cacumina summa terantur Inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>the extreme top</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:898" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 898</bibl></cit>. —So of <hi rend="ital">tree-tops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrosa cacumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 9</bibl></cit>; 6, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 307</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 346</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 552</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 567</bibl>; 8, 257; 8, 716; 8, 756; 9, 389; 10, 140; 10, 193; 13, 833; 15, 396; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO">1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum cacumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficorum, pirorum, malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 14</bibl></cit> and 15; 11, 3, 37; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 25, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apr. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 4, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>.—Of grass, <hi rend="ital">the points of the blades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeacutis (ramorum) cacuminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 459</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">the summits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaks of mountains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 464</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 317</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 666</bibl>; 6, 311; 8, 797; 7, 804; 9, 93; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 75</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 7, § 20 al.</bibl>—Of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">pilorum, Auct. B. Afr. 47: atomi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusque rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 74, § 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10</bibl>. 54, 75, § <cit><quote lang="la">151: metae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37</bibl></cit>. 88, § <cit><quote lang="la">219: ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incurvum, of the elephant's back,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:584" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 584</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5964.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5964.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>: donec alescundi summum<cb n="CADM" />  tetigere cacumen, <hi rend="ital">until they have completely attained the limit of their growth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summum donec venere cacumen,</quote> <trans><tr>to the height of perfection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1456</bibl></cit>: famae, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5964.4" n="B" level="2"> As a gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the mark of accent placed over a letter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cacumino: <entryFree id="n5965" type="main" key="ca^cu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cacumen</etym>, <sense id="n5965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make pointed</hi> (prob. formed by Ovid): <cit><quote lang="la">summas cacuminat aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxoque cacuminat ensem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova cacuminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 74, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex in conum cacuminatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cacus: <entryFree id="n5966" type="main" key="Ca_cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cācus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n5966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Vulcan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Evander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a giant of immense physical strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who dwelt in a cave on Mount Aventinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and troubled the whole region around by his robberies; he robbed even Hercules of the cattle of Geryon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was on that account slain by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:543 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 543 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:190 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 190 sq.</bibl>, and Serv. in h. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 9, 7; 4 (5), 9, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl>, §§ 7 and 18.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5967" type="main" key="ca^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. <foreign lang="greek">kako/s</foreign>; cf. Engl. villain, rascal, as designations of a servant</etym>, <sense id="n5967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, Inscr. Vellerm. 7, 1, 27.</sense></entryFree>
cadaver: <entryFree id="n5968" type="main" key="ca^da_ver"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădāver</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cado, I. B. 2.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 2, 35</bibl>, and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ptw=ma</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">pi/ptw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n5968.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dead body of man</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a corpse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carcass</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n5968.1" n="A" level="2"> Of man: <cit><quote lang="la">taetra cadavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:719" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 719</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:682" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 682</bibl>; 6, 1154; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 1273: aqua cadaveribus inquinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>.—Freq. of the bodies of slaves, criminals, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 85</bibl>.—Of the dead bodies of those who fell in war, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 101 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:85" default="NO">3, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl>.—Of the body of Caligula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 15 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">informe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 264</bibl></cit>.—Esp., as med. t. t. for <hi rend="ital">a corpse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:184" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 70, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2</bibl>, ext. 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 10:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 10, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5968.2" n="B" level="2"> Of brutes: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerat ipsis In stabulis turpi dilapsa cadavera tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 557</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as a term of reproach of a despised, worthless man, <hi rend="ital">a carcass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc ejecto cadavere quidquam mihi aut opis aut ornamenti expetebam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 82</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n5968.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruins of desolated towns</hi>: tot oppidŭm cadavera, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadaverinus: <entryFree id="n5969" type="main" key="ca^da_ve^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădāvĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cadaver</etym>, <sense id="n5969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of carrion</hi>: nidores, Aug. Civ. Dei, 9, 16.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cădāvĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">the flesh of a carcass</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadaverosus: <entryFree id="n5970" type="main" key="ca^da_ve^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădāvĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a corpse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ghastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cadaverous</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit> (sublivida, ac personata rubore et livore, Don.).—Of persons, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 48</bibl>, Serm. 16, 28.</sense></entryFree>
cadi: <entryFree id="n5971" type="main" key="Ca_di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cādi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 8.</sense></entryFree>
cadialis: <entryFree id="n5972" type="hapax" key="ca^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cadus</etym>, <sense id="n5972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a jar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <trans><tr>contained in it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cadivus: <entryFree id="n5973" type="main" key="ca^di_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cado</etym> (an access. form of caducus). <sense id="n5973.0" n="I" level="1"> Of fruit, <hi rend="ital">falling of itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 17, 18, § 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5973.1" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">having the falling sickness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epilepsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epileptic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadmea: <entryFree id="n5974" type="main" key="cadme_^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cadmē^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cadmia.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n5975" type="main" key="Cadme_a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cadmēa</orth>, v. Cadmus, I. B. 1. b.</entryFree>
cadmeis: <entryFree id="n5976" type="main" key="Cadme_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cadmēïs</orth>, etc., v. Cadmus, I. B. 3.</entryFree>
cadmia: <entryFree id="n5977" type="greek" key="cadmi_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cadmī^a</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cadmē^a</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47, 10</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kadmei/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">kadmi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ore of zinc</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cadmia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 2, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 10, 22, § 100</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 20, 2</bibl> and 11.—</sense><sense id="n5977.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The dross</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slag formed in a furnace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22</bibl>. § 100 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 20, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadmitis: <entryFree id="n5978" type="main" key="cadmi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cadmītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadmus: <entryFree id="n5979" type="main" key="Cadmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cadmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/dmos</foreign>. <sense id="n5979.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of the Phœnician king Agenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Europa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Harmonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Polydorus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ino</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Semele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Autonoë</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Agave; founder of the</hi> Cadmea, <hi rend="ital">the citadel of the Bœotian Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3</bibl>. 19, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:490" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 490</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 55</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the inventor of alphabetic writing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 192</bibl> sqq. (hence letters are called Cadmi filiolae atricolores, <cb n="CADO" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Cadmi nigellae filiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>). He and his wife. Harmonia were at last changed into serpents, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:572 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 572 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 187</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:148" default="NO">148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:179" default="NO">179</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">274.—Hence, Cadmi soror,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Europa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5979.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5979.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cadmēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kadmei=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cadmean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus, i. e. Thebana,</quote> <trans><tr>Theban</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:601" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dirce (because in the neighborhood of Thebes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Agave</tr>, <tr>the mother of Pentheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 1005" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 1005</bibl></cit>: cistae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Bacchus</hi> (because Bacchus was the grandson of Cadmus by Semele), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 595" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 595</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyros (because Cadmus came from Phœnicia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 13, 7.—Also <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens, stirps, manus = Carthaginiensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:106" default="NO">1, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:582" default="NO">17, 582</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5979.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cadmēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. arx), <hi rend="ital">the citadel of Thebes founded by Cadmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5979.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cad-mēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cadmean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitrix,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Agave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:565" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 565</bibl></cit>: seges, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the armed men that sprang from the dragon</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s teeth sown by Cadmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:282" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 282</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Theban</tr>, <tr>Polynices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:366" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 366</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Haemon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 458</bibl></cit> and 520.—</sense><sense id="n5979.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cadmēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>acc.</case> Cadmeidem and Cadmeida, Neue, Formenl. 1, 211; 1, 305; <case>voc.</case> Cadmei, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 293</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*kadmhi/+s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cadmean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Theban women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5979.6" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Cadmus;</hi> so of <hi rend="ital">Semele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 287</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Ino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 553</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> Cadmeïdes, <hi rend="ital">the daughters of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Agave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ino</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Autonoë</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 758" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 758</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5979.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An historian of Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">said to have been the earliest prose writer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:205" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57, § 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5979.8" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bloodthirsty executioner in the time of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 39</bibl>; Schol. Crucq.—</sense><sense id="n5979.9" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cado: <entryFree id="n5980" type="main" key="ca^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădo</orth>, <itype>cĕcĭdi, cāsum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n5980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres. gen. plur.</hi> cadentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 674</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 410</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. çad-, to fall away</etym>. </sense><sense id="n5980.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5980.2" n="A" level="2"> In an extended sense, <hi rend="ital">to be driven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carried by one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s weight from a higher to a lower point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be precipitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in prose, in place of it, the compounds decĭdo, occĭdo, excĭdo, etc.; cf. also ruo, labor; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. surgo, sto): tum arbores in te cadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: (aves) praecipites cadunt in terram aut in aquam, <hi rend="ital">fall headlong to the earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into the water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 745</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 828</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Verg.: (apes) praecipites cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus, Ut picis e caelo demissum flumen, in undas Sic cadit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadit in terras vis flammea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 215</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1282" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1282</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1006" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1006</bibl>; 6, 1125; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 64: <cit><quote lang="la">in patrios pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:832" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 832</bibl></cit>.—With a different meaning: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes plerumque cadunt in vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the direction of</tr>, <tr>towards their wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1049" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1049</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolapsa in vulnus moribunda cecidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadit in vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:579" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 579</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 84</bibl></cit>.—The place <hi rend="ital">from which</hi> is designated by <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a summo cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mento cadit manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cadat (avis) e regione loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:30:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 30, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:80:section=2" default="NO">18, 1, 80, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidisse de equo dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere de equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 125</bibl></cit> (for which Cæsar, Nepos, and Pliny employ decidere): <cit><quote lang="la">de manibus arma cecidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de manibus civium delapsa arma ipsa ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadunt altis de montibus umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 791</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de matre (i. e. nasci),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 92</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inane profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per salebras altaque saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:91" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imbre per indignas usque cadente genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—With the adverb <hi rend="ital">altius</hi>: altius atque cadant summotis nubibus imbres, <hi rend="ital">and poured forth from a greater height</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 38</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia nunc cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 297</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pluere in multis regionibus et cadere imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadens nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:402" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut si prolapsus cecidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 12</bibl></cit>: quaeque ita concus <pb n="259" /> <cb n="CADO" /> sa est, ut jam casura putetur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadentem Sustinuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius, of epileptics,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 12, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casuri, si leviter excutiantur, flosculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5980.4" n="a" level="4"> Of heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">to decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> (opp. orior), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:295" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 295</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceani finem juxta solemque cadentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 480</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli subjecta cadenti arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 273</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (nocte) tristis Orion cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcturus cadens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To separate from something by falling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be shed</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tum dentes mihi cadebant primulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes cadere imperat aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 671</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:83:3" default="NO">83, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri qui primus ceciderit dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 9, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa in silvis autumni frigore primo Lapsa cadunt folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 310</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanigeris gregibus Sponte suā lanae cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saetae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedibus pilum cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidere manu quas legerat, herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:350" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elapsae manibus cecidere tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:571" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et colus et fusus digitis cecidere remissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:229" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.6" n="c" level="4"> Of a stream, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Aretho cadit in sinum maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina in pontum cadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 406" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina in Hebrum cadentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem in alterum amnem cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.7" n="d" level="4"> Of dice, <hi rend="ital">to be thrown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast; to turn up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod cecidit forte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:23 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 23 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.8" n="e" level="4"> Alicui (alicujus) ad pedes, <hi rend="ital">to fall at one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s feet</hi> in supplication, etc. (post-class. for abicio, proicio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 143:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 143, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:11:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 11, 32 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5980.9" n="f" level="4"> Super collum allcujus, <hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 15, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.10" n="B" level="2"> In a more restricted sense. </sense><sense id="n5980.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be precipitated</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi> (the usual class. signif. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">cadere in plano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:17 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uspiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus, velut si prolapsus cecidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:12" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 58, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum timent, ne aliquando cadant, semper jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistrā manu sinum ad ima crura deduxit (Caesar), quo honestius caderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere supinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectus pronus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadunt toti montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicitus exturbata (pinus) prona cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concussae cadunt urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casura moenia Troum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 375</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque praeterea ceciderunt moenia magnis motibus in terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 588</bibl></cit>: languescunt omnia membra; <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia palpebraeque cadunt,</quote> <trans><tr>their arms and eyelids fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:953" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 953</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:596" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 596</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ceciderunt artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tibi tamen oculi, voltus, verba cecidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:52:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 52, 133</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos vigiliā fatigatos cadentesque in opere detineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae cecidere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur facunda parum decoro Inter verba cadit lingua silentio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidere illis animique manusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 347</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:300" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 300</bibl>; cf. II. F. infra.—</sense><sense id="n5980.12" n="2" level="3"> In a pregn. signif. (as in most langg., to fall in battle, to die), <hi rend="ital">to fall so as to be unable to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi> (opp. vivere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 28, 42 (usu. of those who die in battle; <cit><quote lang="la">hence most freq. in the histt.): hostes crebri cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:79 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 79 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut in acie cadendum fuit aut in aliquas insidias incidendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum dignitate potius cadamus quam cum ignominiā serviamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci de nostris cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus quisque cadere aut sauciari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 60, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 54, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Thras. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35, 15</bibl> and 19; 21, 7, 10; 23, 21, 7; 29, 14, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipenni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:812" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 812</bibl></cit>.—Not in battle: <cit><quote lang="la">inque pio cadit officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 250</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> of means or instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">suoque Marte (i. e. suā manu) cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā manu cecidit,</quote> <trans><tr>fell by his own hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitu voluntario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebri fraude cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cb n="CADO" /> cecidere justā Morte Centauri, cecidit tremendae Flamma Chimaerae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 14 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu femineā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1179" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineo Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 610</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> of agent with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torqueor, infesto ne vir ab hoste cadat,</quote> <trans><tr>should be slain by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a centurione volneribus adversis tamquam in pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 9</bibl></cit>.—And without <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarae postquam cecidere turmae Thessalo victore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; imitated by Claudian, IV. Cons. Hon. 89; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 315</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5980.13" n="b" level="4"> Of victims, <hi rend="ital">to be slain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sacrificed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">multa tibi ante aras nostrā cadet hostia dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tener pleno cadit haedus anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:15" default="NO">4, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 615</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:653" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 653</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.14" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part., = succumbo, <hi rend="ital">to yield to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.15" n="4" level="3"> Matre cadens, <hi rend="ital">just born</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:355" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 355</bibl>; cf. of the custom of laying the new-born child at the father's feet: tellure cadens. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:209" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 69</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n5980.16" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5980.17" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be subject</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exposed to something</hi> (more rare than its compound incidere, but class.); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, sometimes with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub sensus cadere nostros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be perceived by the senses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl></cit>: in cernendi sensum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectum,</quote> <trans><tr>to become visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aurium mensuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte suā (genus humanum) cecidit sub leges artaque jura,</quote> <trans><tr>subjected itself to law and the force of right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1146</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 848</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad servitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrorum ad regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 836</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub imperium dicionemque Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">in potestatem unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cogitationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to suggest itself to the thoughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hominum disceptationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deliberationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in offensionem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspitionem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calumniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrupte cadere in narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 65:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 65, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5980.18" n="B" level="2"> In gen.: in or sub aliquem or aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to belong to any object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in accordance with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be suitable to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become</hi> (so esp. freq. in philos. and rhet. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">non cadit in hos mores, non in hunc pudorem, non in hanc vitam, non in hunc hominem ista suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadit ergo in bonum virum mentiri, emolumenti sui causā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Academica... in personas non cadebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pedes in orationem non cadere quī possunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:188" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in unam formam cadunt omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; 57, 191; 27, 95; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:37" default="NO">4, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:93" default="NO">4, 2, 93</bibl>; 6, prooem. § 5; 7, 2, 30 and 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, cadit in quemquam tantum scelus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:91" default="NO">3, 6, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:30" default="NO">5, 10, 30</bibl>; 6, 3, 52; 7, 2, 31; 9, 1, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 3, 92: hoc quoque in rerum naturam cadit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis rebus, quae sub eandem rationem cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.19" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon a definite time</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">considera, ne in alienissimum tempus cadat adventus tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id saeculum Romuli cecidit aetas, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in mercantile lang., of payments, <hi rend="ital">to fall due</hi>: in eam diem cadere (<hi rend="ital">were due</hi>) nummos, qui a Quinto debentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.20" n="D" level="2"> (Acc. to I. 1. e.) Alicui, <hi rend="ital">to fall to one</hi> (as by lot), <hi rend="ital">fall to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befall;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (for accidere), <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall out</hi> (esp. in an unexpected manner; cf. accido; very freq. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n5980.21" n="1" level="3"> Alicui: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ipsis jure incommodi cadere possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cecidit mihi peropportune, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperanti mihi, cecidit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:30:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 30, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi omnia semper honesta et jucunda ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt, quibus ad portas cecidit custodia sorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aliis maledicta cadant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:85" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu tibi pro vano verba benigna cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illis... voluptas cadat dura inter saepe pericla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: verba cadentia, <cb n="CADO" /> <hi rend="ital">uttered at random</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.22" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Ab sol.</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic.
