Leg .2, 13, 33: verebar quorsum id casurum esset,</quote> <trans><tr>how it would turn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorsum vota ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliter res cecidisset ac putasses,</quote> <trans><tr>had turned out differently from what was expected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane ita cadebat ut vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:52:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 52, 107</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 5</bibl> Dähne: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, quae tum maxime acciderant, casura praemonens, a furioso incepto eos deterreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 13, 9</bibl>; 38, 46, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 709</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia fortiter fiant, feliciter cadant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2, p. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, p. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa. fortuito in melius casura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 77</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non omnia caderent secunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota cadunt, i.e. rata sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are fulfilled</tr>, <tr>realized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit> (diff. from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl>; v. under F.).—</sense><sense id="n5980.23" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: nimia illa libertas et populis et privatis in nimiam servitutem cadit (cf. <foreign lang="greek">metaba/llei</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl>.—Esp.: in (ad) irritum or cassum, <hi rend="ital">to be frustrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain fruitless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in cassum cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad irritum cadens spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in irritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. with <itype>irritus</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut irrita promissa ejus caderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud irritae cecidere minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 35, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.24" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become less</hi> (in strength, power, worth, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to decrease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadunt vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercenarii milites pretia militiae casura in pace aegre ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 36, 7</bibl></cit>.—More freq. in an extended signif. (acc. to I. B. 2.), </sense><sense id="n5980.25" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lose all one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5980.26" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: pellis item cecidit, vestis contempta ferina. <hi rend="ital">declined in value</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1417</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpius est enim privatim cadere (i. e. fortunis everti) quam publice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ea quidem tua laus pariter cum re publicā cecidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta civitas, si cadet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc cecidisse Germanici exercitus gloriam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi ingredienti fines ira cecidit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:91" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia nec debilitari animos aut cadere patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <trans><tr>to fail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 537</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:347" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 347</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debemus ita cadere animis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose courage</tr>, <tr>be disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to fail</hi> in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus orator est... minimeque in lubrico versabitur, et si semel constiterit numquam cadet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte enim cadere non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> —So in the lang. of the jurists, causā or formulā, <hi rend="ital">to lose one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causā cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 57</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:166 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 166 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formulā cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 69</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita quemquam cadere in judicio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 28, 58</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus repetundarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cecidit Fortuna Phrygum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omniaque ingrato litore vota cadunt, i. e. irrita sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>remain unfulfilled</tr>, <tr>unaccomplished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit> (diff. from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>; v. above, D. 2.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at mea nocturno verba cadunt zephyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa renascentur, quae jam cecidere, cadentque Quae nunc sunt in honore vocabula,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall into disuse</tr>, <tr>grow out of date</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 70</bibl></cit> —Hence of theatrical representations, <hi rend="ital">to fall through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be condemned</hi> (opp. stare, to win applause; <cit><quote lang="la">the fig. derived from combatants): securus cadat an recto stet fabula talo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 176</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers..</hi> periculum est, ne cadatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Don. Persev. 1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Don. Persev. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5980.27" n="2" level="3"> Esp. of the wind (opp. surgo), <hi rend="ital">to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die away</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cadit Eurus et umida surgunt Nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus premente nebulā cecidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadente jam Euro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 27, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti vis omnis cecidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum aquilones ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 43, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic cunctus pelagi cecidit fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosi ceciderunt murmuris aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 354</bibl> Serv. and Wagn.—</sense><sense id="n5980.28" n="G" level="1"> Rhet. and gram. t. t. of words, syllables, clauses, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be terminated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba melius in syllabas longiores cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:194" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">67, 223</bibl>: qua (littera <pb n="260" /> <cb n="CADU" /> sc. m) nullum Graece verbum cadit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique censent cadere tantum numerose oportere terminarique sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:199" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 199</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apto cadens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus opportune cadens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima syllaba in gravem vel duas graves cadit semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 33</bibl></cit> Spald.: similiter cadentia = <foreign lang="greek">o/moio/ptwta</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the ending of words with the same cases</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verbal forms</hi>, diff. from similiter desinentia = <foreign lang="greek">o/moiote/leuta</foreign>, similar endings of any kind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:78" default="NO">9, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:79" default="NO">9, 3, 79</bibl>; 1, 7, 23; Aquil. Rom. Figur. §§ 25 and 26.</sense></entryFree>
caducarius: <entryFree id="n5981" type="main" key="ca^du_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădūcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caducus</etym>, <sense id="n5981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to property without a master</hi>: lex Julia (introduced by Augustus), Ulp. Lib. Regul. § 28.—</sense><sense id="n5981.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Epileptic</hi>: homines, Aug. Vit. Beat. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
caduceator: <entryFree id="n5982" type="main" key="ca_du_ce^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cādūcĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caduceum</etym>. <sense id="n5982.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A herald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an officer sent with a flag of truce</hi>: caduceatores = legati pacem petentes. Cato caduceatori, inquit, nemo homo nocet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellantes ac dissidentes interpretum oratione sedantur, unde secundum Livium legati pacis caduceatores appellantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 242</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 38, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 32, 5</bibl>; 37, 45, 4; 44, 46, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:15 al" default="NO">4, 2, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5982.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A servant to a priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caduceatus: <entryFree id="n5983" type="gloss" key="ca_du_ce^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cādūcĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caduceus</etym>, <sense id="n5983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bearing the herald</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 927, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caduceum: <entryFree id="n5984" type="main" key="ca_du_ce^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cādūcĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. sceptrum or baculum), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cādūcĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. scipio or baculus; which form was predominant in the class. per. is doubtful, since neither Cicero, Nepos, Livy, nor Pliny uses the word in the <case>nom.</case>) [kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">khru/keion</foreign>, Æolic <foreign lang="greek">karu/kion</foreign>, —<foreign lang="greek">u=</foreign>—, r changed to d, as ad = ar], <sense id="n5984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a herald</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the token of a peaceable embassy</hi> (orig. an olive- stick, with <foreign lang="greek">ste/mmata</foreign>, which afterwards were formed into serpents, O. Müll. Archaeol. § 379, 3): caduceus pacis signum, Var. de Vita Pop. Rom.lib. ii.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 528, 17</bibl>: caduceo ornatus, * Cic. de Or: 1, 46, 202; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum caduceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caduceum praeferentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 54</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">the staff</hi> of Mercury, as messenger of the gods, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 242</bibl>, and 8, 138; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercuriale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 262, 4; cf. Dict. Antiq. s. v.; v. also caducifer.</sense></entryFree>
caducifer: <entryFree id="n5985" type="main" key="ca_du_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cādūcĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caduceusfero</etym>, <sense id="n5985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing a herald</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s staff</hi>, an epithet of Mercury in Ovid: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlantiades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 627</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:708" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 605</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 449</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caduciter: <entryFree id="n5986" type="main" key="ca^du_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădūcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. caducus <sense id="n5986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
caducus: <entryFree id="n5987" type="main" key="ca^du_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădūcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cado</etym>. <sense id="n5987.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That falls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">has fallen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallen</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): bacae glandesque caducae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1362</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans caduca est, quae ex arbore cecidit: oleae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spica,</quote> <trans><tr>that fell in mowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 840</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, triste lignum, te caducum In domini caput immerentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 53: <cit><quote lang="la">moro coma nigrior caduco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:64:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 64, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5987.1" n="B" level="2"> Caduca auspicia dicunt cum aliquid in templo excidit, veluti virga e manu, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 9</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n5987.2" n="2" level="3"> Caduci bello, <hi rend="ital">that have fallen in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain in battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello caduci Dardanidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 481</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5987.3" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">devoted to death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destined to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 622</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5987.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that easily falls</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitis, quae naturā caduca est et, nisi fulta sit, ad terram fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n5987.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in medic. lang.: homo, <hi rend="ital">epileptic</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6, n. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">Aemil. Mac. c. de Paeonia: equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus morbo detestabili caducus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>the falling sickness</tr>, <tr>epilepsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 60</bibl></cit>; Aemil. Mac. c. Aristoloch.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5987.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5987.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">frail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transitory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi> (class., esp. in prose): <cit><quote lang="la">in eo, qui ex animo constet et corpus caducus et infirmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>quickly extinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res humanae fragiles caducaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>: quis <cb n="CAEC" /> confidit semper sibi illud stabile et firmum permansurum, quod fragile et caducum sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nisi mortale et caducum praeter animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: alia omnia incerta sunt, caduca, mobilia; <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est una altissimis defixa radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:58:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 58, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tituli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <trans><tr>vain</tr>, <tr>futile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <trans><tr>ineffectual</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:181" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5987.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in law, caduca bona were <hi rend="ital">those possessions which did not fall to the heir mentioned in a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because he was childless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but passed to other heirs</hi> (in default of such, to the exchequer); <hi rend="ital">vacant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having no heir</hi> (cf. Hugo, Rechtsgesch. p. 760 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod quis sibi testamento relictum, ita ut jure civili capere possit, aliquă ex causă deinde non ceperit, caducum appellatur, veluti ceciderit ab eo, etc., Ulp. Lib. Regul. tit. 10: hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 10, 10, 30 pr.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 9</bibl>: portio, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 206</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cădūcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">property without an heir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an unowned eslate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum omne capis nec non et dulce caducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caduca occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: vindicare, Gal <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 207</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5987.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra est omnis ista prudentiae doctrinaeque possessio, in quam homines, quasi caducam atque vacuam, abundantes otio, nobis occupatis, involaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 122</bibl></cit> (no <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cădū-cĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">precipitately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headlong</hi>: caduciter = praecipitanter; <cit><quote lang="la">Varro: aquai caduciter ruentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 91, 1 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cadurci: <entryFree id="n5988" type="main" key="Ca^durci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cădurci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kadou=rkoi</foreign>, <sense id="n5988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">whose capital was Divona</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cahors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 1, 2, § 8</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>, with the appel. Eleutheri (perh. a division of the former people, in the present <hi rend="ital">Alby</hi>).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cădurcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Cadurci</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 282</bibl></cit>: sedes, Aus. Prof. n. 17.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cădurcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Cadurcian coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coverlet of Cadurcian linen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 221</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and meton.,</quote> <trans><tr>a bed ornamented with a Cadurcian coverlet</tr>, <tr>a marriage-bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:537" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 537</bibl></cit> Schol.</sense></entryFree>
cadus: <entryFree id="n5989" type="greek" key="ca^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cădus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n5989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> cadūm, v. II. infra), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/dos</foreign> [Slav. kad, kadĭ; Serv. kada; Magyar, kád; Rouman. Kadŭ]. </sense><sense id="n5989.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a large vessel for containing liquids</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">wine; a bottle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jug; mostly of earthen-ware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but sometimes of stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 43, § 158</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">even of metal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 228</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n5989.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wine-jar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-flask</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadi = vasa, quibus vina conduntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 544, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadus erat vini: inde implevi hirneam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 273</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadum capite sistere,</quote> <trans><tr>to upset</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina bonus quae deinde cadis onerarat Acestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 243</bibl></cit>.—Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Parce cadis tibi destinatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; 3, 14, 18.—</sense><sense id="n5989.3" n="B" level="2"> For other uses: <cit><quote lang="la">for containing honey,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">oil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:44:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, olearii,</quote> <trans><tr>oil-jars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 307</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for fruits,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">figs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">aloes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a money-pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:27:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 27, 6</bibl>; also = urna, <hi rend="ital">a funeral urn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 228</bibl></cit> Heyne.—</sense><sense id="n5989.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a measure for liquids</hi> (in this sense, <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> cadum, Lucil. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 544, 13</bibl> and 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 17, § 96</bibl>); syn. with amphora Attica (usu. = 1 1/2 amphorae, or 3 urnae, or 4 1/2 modii, or 12 congii, or 72 sextarii), Rhemn. Fann. Ponder. 84; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:96 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 15, 17, § 96 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 26, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadusii: <entryFree id="n5990" type="main" key="Ca^du_sii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cădūsii</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cădūsi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kadou/sioi</foreign>, <sense id="n5990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Media</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Caspian Sea</hi> (Atropatene). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cădusus</orth>, i., <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 910</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cădūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Cadusii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cadytas: <entryFree id="n5991" type="greek" key="cadytas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cadytas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kadu/tas</foreign>, <sense id="n5991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Syrian parasitical pl'ant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecator: <entryFree id="n5992" type="hapax" key="caeca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caeco, prop. one who makes blind, hence</etym>, <sense id="n5992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who stops</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obstructs a fountain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. Nat. S. Fel. 24, 9, 618</bibl> (with ref. to Genes. 26, 15). <cb n="CAEC" /></sense></entryFree>
caeciae: <entryFree id="n5993" type="main" key="Caeciae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caeciae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two small islands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite the promontory of Spirœum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Argolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecias: <entryFree id="n5994" type="greek" key="caeci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaiki/as</foreign>, <sense id="n5994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the northeast wind</hi> (acc. to more accurate nautical designation, <hi rend="ital">north-east by east</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:334" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 34, 77, § 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 24</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 4</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
caecigenus: <entryFree id="n5995" type="hapax" key="caeci^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (caecigena <foreign lang="greek">tuflogenh/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caeco-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n5995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born blind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 741</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecilia: <entryFree id="n5996" type="main" key="caeci^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n5996.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of lizard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:4" default="NO">6, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 76, § 166</bibl>: caecus serpens); now Ital. cecella; Sard. cicigna.—</sense><sense id="n5996.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of lettuce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:190" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 190</bibl>; cf. Caecilius, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
caecilianus: <entryFree id="n5997" type="main" key="Caeci^li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Caecilius, II. B. 2.</entryFree>
caecilius: <entryFree id="n5998" type="main" key="Caeci^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n5998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n5998.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Caecilius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Caecilius Metellus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">His son of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also Balearicus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for his triumph over the Baleares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.4" n="4" level="3"> Caia (Gaia) Caecilia, <hi rend="ital">the Roman name of</hi> Tanaquil, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.5" n="5" level="3"> Caeciliae, <hi rend="ital">daughters of Q. Cœcilius Metellus the elder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:47:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 47, 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.6" n="6" level="3"> Caecilia, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Metellus Balearicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl>, and 2, 40, 83.— </sense><sense id="n5998.7" n="7" level="3"> Caecilius Statius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the ante-class. per.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Gallic origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Ennius;</hi> his comedies were by the ancients considered equal to those of Plaut. and Ter., and by many even preferred to them, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 374, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:54 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 54 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl>; Vulcatius Sedigitus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.8" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5998.9" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cae-cĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cœcilian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Cœcilius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex de ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex de repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Didia lex de legibus ferendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 16, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5998.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecĭlĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cœcilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex (in a comedy of Cæcilius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca (named after Q. Cæcilius Metellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 127</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:182" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 182</bibl>.—Also, </sense><sense id="n5998.11" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecina: <entryFree id="n5999" type="main" key="Caeci_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cēc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Licinia, <hi rend="ital">originating in Etruria</hi> (pure Etrusc. Ceicna, O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 416), among whom the most celebrated is Licinius Cæcina, for whose Roman citizenship Cicero made the oration pro Caecinā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:49:1" default="NO">2, 49, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeciniana oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 527</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6000" type="main" key="Caeci_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cēc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Cecina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6000.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecitas: <entryFree id="n6001" type="main" key="caeci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caecus</etym>, <sense id="n6001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blindness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6001.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but in good prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 38, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 8, 18, § 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6001.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem autem esse rati sunt mentis ad omnia caecitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furore animi et caecitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:50:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 50, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an tibi luminis obesset caecitas plus quam libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 18, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caecitudo: <entryFree id="n6002" type="hapax" key="caeci^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blindness; plur.</hi>, Opilius Aur. ap. Fest. s. v. nusciciosum, p. 173 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
caeco: <entryFree id="n6003" type="main" key="caeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caeco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6003.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol caecat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 325</bibl></cit> (300); <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. Nat. S. Fel. 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde caecatus est (Appius Claudius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 34:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 34, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in gardening: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:16" default="NO">4, 24, 16</bibl>; cf. caecus, I. C., and oculus.— </sense><sense id="n6003.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui largitione caecarunt mentes imperitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (animi acies) ne caecetur erroribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecati libidinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecata mens subito terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora... serie caecata laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecabitur spes vindemiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidos artus,</quote> <trans><tr>to make senseless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6003.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecantur silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Per. 504</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6003.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of <pb n="261" /> <cb n="CAEC" /> discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritate caecata oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>rendered obscure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:264" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 264</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caecubum: <entryFree id="n6004" type="main" key="Caecu^bum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecŭbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kai/koubon</foreign>, <sense id="n6004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marshy place in Southern Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Amyclœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for producing the most excellent kind of Roman wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:115" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6004.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecŭbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cœcuban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 31</bibl></cit>: vina, Hor S. 2, 8, 15.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecŭbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">Cœcuban wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 36</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:115" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 115</bibl>. (From a neglect of the vines, and still more from a canal made by Nero, which drew off the water, the vineyards here, even in the time of Pliny the elder, were in a state of decay, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 61</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
caeculto: <entryFree id="n6005" type="hapax" key="caeculto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caeculto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>contr for caeculĭto, from caecus, as ausculto for ausculito, from auris</etym>, <sense id="n6005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be like one blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be dim-sighted</hi>: caecultare est caecos imitari, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.: caeculto <foreign lang="greek">a/mbluw/ttw</foreign>, Gloss.; Plautus: numnam mihi oculi caecultant? Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62</bibl> Müll.; cf. caecutio.</sense></entryFree>
caeculus: <entryFree id="n6006" type="main" key="Caecu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Vulcan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of Prœneste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:678 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 678 sq.</bibl> Serv.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecus: <entryFree id="n6007" type="main" key="caecus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">coecus</orth>; sometimes in MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>akin to <foreign lang="greek">skia/, sko/tos</foreign>; Sanscr. khāyā, shadow</etym>, <sense id="n6007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having no light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoid of light.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6007.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6007.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius, qui caecus annos multos fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditum est enim Homerum caecum fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 839</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli, qui jam dispecturi sunt, caeci aeque et hi qui modo nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si facie miserabili senis, caeci, infantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecum corpus,</quote> <trans><tr>the blind part of the body</tr>, <tr>the back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices caecae impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.3" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si Caecus iter monstrare velit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet id quidem etiam caeco,</quote> <trans><tr>even a blind man can see that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecis hoc, ut aiunt, satis clarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mentally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morally blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blinded</hi> (freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">o pectora caeca!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum ipsa Fortuna caeca est, sed eos etiam plerumque efficit caecos, quos complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus atque amens tribunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecum me et praecipitem ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater caeca crudelitate et scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 23, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem mala stultitia Caecum agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorem amicae Turpia decipiunt caecum vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 43</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus ad has belli artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati futuri,</quote> <trans><tr>ignorant of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 138</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caeci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the blind people</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the people of Chalcedon</hi>, according to the oracle at Delphi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 63</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 149</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6007.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of the passions themselves: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca honorum cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 620</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac temeraria dominatrix animi cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:762" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca et sopita socordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.6" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">blind</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">at random</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aimless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac calumniā timoris et caecae suspitionis tormento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeco quodam timore... quaerebant aliquem ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecique in nubibus ignes Terrificant animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca regens filo vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sint caecae, pater, exsecrationes tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et caeco flentque paventque metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:822" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphatis caeco pavore animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervus... Caeco timore proximam villam petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6007.8" n="1" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">without buds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 54, § 125</bibl></cit>; cf. caeco and oculus. —</sense><sense id="n6007.9" n="2" level="3"> Of the large intestine: <cit><quote lang="la">intestinum,</quote> <trans><tr>the cœcum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.10" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be seen</hi>, or trop., <hi rend="ital">that cannot be known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invisible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6007.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sunt igitur venti <cb n="CAED" /> nimirum corpora caeca, <hi rend="ital">winds are accordingly bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although invisible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:296" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:329" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 329</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 713: vallum caecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: caecum vallum dicitur, in quo praeacuti pali terrae affixi herbis vel frondibus occuluntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=44" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 44</bibl> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <trans><tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 3</bibl>. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">in vada caeca ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <trans><tr>private</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colubri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:231" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:929" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 929</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <trans><tr>blind ways</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae armaque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 2, 214</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 706</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>a secret wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1116</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also,</quote> <trans><tr>a wound upon the back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 733</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:105" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 105</bibl> (cf.: caecum corpus, <hi rend="ital">the back</hi>, I. A. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">caeca manus, i.e. abscondita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecum domūs scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecas exponere causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improba navigii ratio, tum caeca jacebat,</quote> <trans><tr>lay still concealed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1004</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">venti potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 270</bibl>: fluctus, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 449, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca et clandestina natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res caecae et ab aspectūs judicio remotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurum atque caecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <trans><tr>secret conspiracies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 210</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos in pectore caecos Condidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 726</bibl></cit>. In Plaut. once, prob. taken from the vulgar lang.: caecā die emere, <hi rend="ital">upon a concealed</hi> (<hi rend="ital">pay-</hi>) <hi rend="ital">day</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to purchase on credit</hi> (opp. oculata dies, i.e. for ready money): <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Pereo inopiā argentariā. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Emito die caecā hercle olivom, id vendito oculatā die, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.13" n="2" level="3"> By <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license, transf. to the hearing: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 591</bibl></cit> (as we, by a similar meton., say <hi rend="ital">a hollow sound;</hi> cf. on the other hand, in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tuflo\s ta\ w)=ta</foreign>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:461" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitusterrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 171" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.14" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that obstructs the sight</hi>, or trop., <hi rend="ital">the perception; dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6007.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 476</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 521</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:457" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 908</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:746" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 746</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:798" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 798</bibl>; 3, 87; 6, 35; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 87: silentia, i.e. nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:350" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 299</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:372" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum si fenestram non habet, dicitur caecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.
