L. 9, § 58</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>without windows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sardonyches,</quote> <trans><tr>not transparent</tr>, <tr>opaque</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 68</bibl></cit>: acervus (of chaos), <hi rend="ital">chaotic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, Ov M. 1, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 4</bibl>' chaos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 741" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 741</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:456" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 456</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6007.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>: obscurā spe et caecā exspectatione pendere, i.e. <hi rend="ital">of an uncertain consequence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod temere fit caeco casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>. cursus (Fortunae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 567</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeci morbi, quorum causas ne medici quidem perspicere queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:55" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 13, § 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>that cannot be proved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 31, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caecum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">verum in caeco esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 304</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 91</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in. use.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6008" type="main" key="Caecus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caecus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; agnomen of Appius Claudius Crassus, as being <sense id="n6008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caecutio: <entryFree id="n6009" type="main" key="caecu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caecūtĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype> (no <sense id="n6009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>from caecus, like balbutio from balbus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see badly</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 35, 4</bibl>: omnes quodammodo caecutimus, App. Flor. n. 2: utrum oculi mihi caecutiunt, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caedes: <entryFree id="n6010" type="main" key="caedes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caedes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n6010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> regularly caedium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:14 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 14 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but caedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:665" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 665</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:353" default="NO">4, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:423" default="NO">4, 423</bibl>; 4, 796; 5, 220; 10, 233; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 5, 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 771</bibl> P), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caedo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n6010.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6010.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lopping off</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ligni atque frondium caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli, qui caede cultrorum desecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6010.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. (acc. to caedo, I. B. 1.; cf. cado, I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">a cutting down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">massacre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnage;</hi> esp. in battle or by an assassin; <hi rend="ital">murder</hi> (usu. class. signif. of the word in <cb n="CAED" /> prose and poetry; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the histt. in Suet. alone more than twenty times): pugnam caedesque petessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem caede accumulantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 71</bibl></cit>: caedem (<hi rend="ital">the deadly slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conflict</hi>) in quā P. Clodius occisus est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes et occisio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecil. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum privatorumque caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in silvā Silā facta caedes esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notat (Catilina) et designat oculis ad caedem unumquemque nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam non pugna sed caedes erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes inde, non jam pugna fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex mediā caede effugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 29, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caedibus et incendiis agrum perpopulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 56, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestres homines... Caedibus et victu foedo deterruit Orpheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā caede factā multisque occisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem in aliquem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 45, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:12" default="NO">10, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:43" default="NO">7, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abnuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni caede abhorrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: portendere, Sall.J. 3, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the poets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 500</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 12</bibl>; 3, 24, 26; 4, 4, 59; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 503</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 625</bibl>; 4, 160; 5, 69; 6, 669.—</sense><sense id="n6010.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The slaughter of animals</hi>, esp. of <hi rend="ital">victims</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosus caedis ferinae, i. e. ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 675</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:809" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 809</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:442" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 442</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 106: armenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:541" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:371" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6010.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6010.6" n="A" level="2"> (Abstr. pro concreto.) <hi rend="ital">The persons slain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">murdered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the slain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis acervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenae caedibus viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6010.7" n="B" level="2"> Also meton. as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fo/nos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the blood shed by murder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 643</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1312" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1312</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permixta flumina caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respersus fraternā caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madefient caede sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidā recens Caede locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsae caede comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede madentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 143</bibl>; 4, 97; 4, 125; 4, 163; 6, 657; 8, 444; 9, 73; 13, 389; 15, 174.—</sense><sense id="n6010.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An attempt to murder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae injuria caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 256</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6010.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A striking with the fist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a beating</hi> (post-class.): contumeliosa, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; 2, 1, 18.</sense></entryFree>
caedo: <entryFree id="n6011" type="main" key="caedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caedo</orth>, <itype>cĕcīdi</itype> (in MSS. freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">caecīdi</orth>, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 460), <itype>caesum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root cīd- for scid-; cf. scindo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sxi/zw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n6011.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6011.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n6011.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut to pieces</hi>: caesa abiegna trabes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl> (Trag. v. 281 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">frondem querneam caedito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 769</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>. 63: silvam, Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 272, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 329</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 418</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 94</bibl>; 9, 230; 9, 374; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 535: harundinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:59:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 59, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris auctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus latius quam caederetur ruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesis montis fodisse medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 111</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caedi montis in marmora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: lapis caedendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga rotunda et apte caesa,</quote> <trans><tr>cut out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 139</bibl></cit>: caedunt securibus umida vina, <hi rend="ital">with axes they cut out the wine</hi> (formerly liquid, now frozen), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 364</bibl>: volutas, <hi rend="ital">to carve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hollow out volutes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>: tineae omnia caedunt, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 272, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6011.3" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vineta egomet caedam mea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>carry my own hide to market</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 220</bibl></cit> (proverbium in eos dicitur, qui sibi volentes nocent, Schol. Crucq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:98" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 672</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n6011.4" n="c" level="4"> Ruta caesa; v <itype>ruo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n6011.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to strike upon something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to knock at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cudgel</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lapidem ferro quom caedimus evolat ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>strike upon with iron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedere januam saxis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silicem rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa dolabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur, pectus, frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:123 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 123 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>, <pb n="262" /> <cb n="CAEL" /> 43: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at validis socios caedebant dentibus apri,</quote> <trans><tr>they fell with their strong tusks upon their own party</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1325</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgis ad necem caedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum saxis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferulā aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeduntur (agrestes) inter potentium inimicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:61:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 61, 27</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">nudatos virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastilibus caedentes terga trepidantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum sub furcā caesum medio egerat circo, i.e. ita ut simul caederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6011.6" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos pugnis caedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to kick against the pricks</tr>, <tr>to aggravate a danger by foolish resistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6011.7" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in judicio testibus caeditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is pressed</tr>, <tr>hard pushed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6011.8" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n6011.9" n="1" level="3"> (Cf. cado, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To strike mortally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille dies, quo Ti. Gracchus est caesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Africanus de Tiberio Graccho responderat jure caesum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeso Argo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 533</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 113</bibl>; 12, 590; 12, 603; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76 al.</bibl> —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. to <hi rend="ital">the blood shed in slaying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeso sparsuros sanguine flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 82</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n6011.10" n="b" level="4"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to slay a single enemy;</hi> or, when a hostile army as a whole is spoken of, <hi rend="ital">to conquer with great slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (cf. Oud., Wolf, and Baumg.Crus. upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus caesus fususque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani insecuti (hostem), caedentes spoliantesque caesos, castra regia diripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 47, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infra arcem caesi captique multi mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:61:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 61, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 7, 2</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim obvios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propugnatores reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesus (hostis) per calles saltusque vagando circumagatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 36, 10</bibl></cit> Kreyss.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem exercitumque caesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio-nes nostras cecidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>.— And <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, the leader is put for the army: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhum et ingentem cecidit Antiochum Hannibalemque dirum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—In <usg type="style">poet.</usg> hypallage: <cit><quote lang="la">caesi corporum acervi (for caesorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 359</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6011.11" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To slaughter animals</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">for offerings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedit greges armentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum mentes caesis hostiis placare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesis victimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:6 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 59</bibl>; Ov.M.13, 637; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:447" default="NO">6, 447</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:156" default="NO">8, 156</bibl>; 12, 3 al.: inter caesa et porrecta; v. porricio.—</sense><sense id="n6011.12" n="d" level="4"> Hence, since security for a person was anciently given by the deposit of sheep belonging to him, which were slaughtered in case of forfeiture, leg. t. t.: pignus caedere (or concidere), <hi rend="ital">to declare the for feiture of a security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confiscate a pledge</hi>: non tibi illa sunt caedenda, si L. Crassum vis coërcere, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6011.13" n="2" level="3"> In mal. part. ( = concido; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hoc, caede, concide: nonne vobis verba depromere videtur ad omne genus nequitiae accommodata?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 25, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6011.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: caedere sermones, a Grecism, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 18, p. 1118</bibl> P., = <foreign lang="greek">ko/ptein ta\ r(h/mata</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to chop words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 272, 13</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1188</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio caesa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>asyndeton</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 26</bibl></cit>; Aquil. Rom. §§ 18 and 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">§ 528</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">caesum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">n.; subst.</hi> in gram. synon. with comma, <hi rend="ital">a stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comma</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 527</bibl>; Aquil. Rom. § 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Art. Rhet. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caeduus: <entryFree id="n6012" type="main" key="caeduus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caeduus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n6012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [caedo], <hi rend="ital">that can be cut without injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for cutting;</hi> a t. t. of agriculture, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:141" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 32, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caelamen: <entryFree id="n6013" type="main" key="caela_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>caelo</etym>, <sense id="n6013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basso-relievo</hi> (prob. formed by Ovid; <cit><quote lang="la">rare): clipei caelamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 291</bibl></cit>; App. Flor, n. 7; id. de Deo Socr. p 40, 30 Elm. <cb n="CAEL" /></sense></entryFree>
caelator: <entryFree id="n6014" type="main" key="caela_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caelo</etym>, <sense id="n6014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artisan in basso-relievo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engraver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 27, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti caelatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 3</bibl>; Inscr Grut. 583, 5 al.</sense></entryFree>
caelatura: <entryFree id="n6015" type="main" key="caela_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of engraving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carving bass-reliefs in metals and ivory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engraving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celature.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6015.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelatura, quae auro, argento, aere, ferro opera efficit: nam sculptura etiam lignum, ebur, marmor, vitrum, gemmas, praeterea quae supra dixi, complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelatura altior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6015.2" n="B" level="2"> In other substances, e. g. in clay, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 158</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 1, 13</bibl>; cf. caelo, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n6015.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">the engraved figures themselves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carved work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque adeo attritis caelaturis, ne figura discerni possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 8</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
caelebs: <entryFree id="n6016" type="main" key="caelebs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelebs</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">coelebs</orth>), <itype>lĭbis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n6016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmarried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi> (whether of a bachelor or a widower) </sense><sense id="n6016.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(censores) equitum peditumque prolem describunto: caelibes esse prohibento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl> Baumg.-Crus.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelebs senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelebs quid agam Martiis Calendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:63" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 63</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6016.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <trans><tr>the life of a bachelor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:163" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6016.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6016.4" n="A" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">caelebs aut vidua columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6016.5" n="B" level="2"> Of trees to which no vine is attached (cf. marito): <cit><quote lang="la">caelebs platanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 663</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 204</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caeles: <entryFree id="n6017" type="main" key="caele^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĕs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum; v Corss. Ausspr. II. p. 210</etym>, <sense id="n6017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heavenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celestial</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; access. form of caelestis, but not found in <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>): di caelites. Enn. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 353 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae ( = ruris dei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus (opp. vulgaris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 281, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:236" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub caelite mensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 24, 9 al.</bibl></cit>—Esp. freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭ-tes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gods</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 163 Rib.); Pac. ib. § 34 ib (Trag. Rel. v. 232 Rib.); Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 398, 19</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 298 ib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 2</bibl>; Cic. (poëta? v. Moser) Rep. 6, 9, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:48" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:49" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:56" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> M 5, 322</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelitum populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33, 33, § 119</bibl>; Eum. Pan. Const, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aulam caelitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, §§ 62 and 222.—So, rare in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caelestini: <entryFree id="n6018" type="main" key="Caelesti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caelestinus: <entryFree id="n6019" type="gloss" key="caelesti_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum</etym>, <sense id="n6019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heavenly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">IOVI OPTIMO MAXIMO CAELESTINO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 430, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6020" type="main" key="Caelesti_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelestīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a late Roman historian</hi>, Treb. Poll. Val. Jun. 8, 1.</sense></entryFree>
caelestis: <entryFree id="n6021" type="main" key="caelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelestis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n6021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> CAELESTAE, Inscr. Neapol. 2602; <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> regularly, caelesti: <cit><quote lang="la">caeleste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 277</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 743</bibl>; cf.: bimestris, cognominis, perennis, patruelis, etc.; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> caelestum, but caelestium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Epigr. v. 9</bibl> Vahl.; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 68</bibl>, or <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 209</bibl> Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 53</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:205" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 150</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to heaven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found in heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming from heaven</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">heavenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celestial</hi> (class. and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignis fulminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 384</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turbine correptus et igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1093" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1093</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes igne caelesti flagrasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>the rainbow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:8" default="NO">7, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:388" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:671" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 671</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 40</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:846" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërii mellis dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: caelestia auguria vocant cum fulminat aut tonat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 8</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes, quorum unus est caelestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caelestĭa</orth>, <cb n="CAEL" /> <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the heavenly bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitantes supera atque caelestia, haec nostra, ut exigua et minima, contemnimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6021.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6021.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Divine;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the deity</hi> (most freq. like caeles in <number>plur.</number>), <hi rend="ital">the gods.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6021.3" n="1" level="3"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, numen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 367</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: aula, Ov F 1, 139: irae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 441" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 760</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:743" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:252" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 252</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <trans><tr>of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 289</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitio caelestium et mortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 86</bibl>.— * <hi rend="ital">Comp neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est caelesti caelestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 11</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6021.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caelestis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>: quicumque dedit formam caelestis avarae, Tib 2, 4, 35.—Mostly <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the gods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos et eos qui caelestes semper habiti colunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestum templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in concilio caelestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:205" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:76" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 387</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 594</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 72, 6, 171</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6021.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelestis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female divinity in Carthage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 24</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 4, 2</bibl>; Macrin. 3, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 29, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6021.6" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">caelestĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">heavenly objects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec caelelestia semper spectato, illa humana con-t emnito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:19:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 19, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientem non modo cognitione caelestium vel mortalium putant instruendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6021.7" n="B" level="2"> As in most languages, an epithet of any thing splendid or excellent, <hi rend="ital">celestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">god-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preeminent</hi>, etc. (so most freq. since the Aug. per., esp. as a complimentary term applied to eminent persons and their qualities; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. only once): caelestes divinaeque legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem prope caelestem fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:534" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo vir (sc. Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestissimum os (Ciceronis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ju dicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2 Spald.: praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:94:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 94, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestissimorum ejus operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 104, 3</bibl></cit>: quos Elea domum reducit Palma caelestes, <hi rend="ital">glorified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like the gods</hi>, Hor C. 4, 2, 18.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
caelianus: <entryFree id="n6022" type="main" key="Caeli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭānus</orth>, v. Caelius, I.</entryFree>
caelibaris: <entryFree id="n6023" type="gloss" key="caeli^ba_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭbāris</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭbālis</orth> <itype>hasta</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 631</bibl> P.), <sense id="n6023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small spear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the point of which the bride</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hair was divided into six locks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 16</bibl> Müll. (Respecting the origin of this custom, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F, 2, 560</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
caelibatus: <entryFree id="n6024" type="main" key="caeli^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭbātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caelebs</etym>, <sense id="n6024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">celibacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single life</hi> (severely punished by the leges Julia and Papia Poppaea; <cit><quote lang="la">only post-Aug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 5</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caelicola: <entryFree id="n6025" type="main" key="caeli^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭcŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n6025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> caelicolūm, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1103</bibl> P., or Ann. v 483 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Sym. 1, 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelicolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 42</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelumcolo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n6025.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dwelling in heaven</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a god</hi>, Enn. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 641</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 554</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 787</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 637</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:111" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6025.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A worshipper of the heavens</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 43; 16, 8, 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caeliculus: <entryFree id="n6026" type="main" key="Caeli^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭcŭlus</orth>, v. Caeliolus.</entryFree>
caelicus: <entryFree id="n6027" type="main" key="caeli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum</etym>, = caelestis, II. B., <sense id="n6027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">celestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S.2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Cap 9:section=891" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Cap 9, § 891</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Nom. Christ. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caelifer: <entryFree id="n6028" type="main" key="caeli^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭfer</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n6028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supporting the heavens</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epi. thet of Atlas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 796</bibl>.—And of Hercules: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 528" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <trans><tr>extolling to heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 637</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
caelifluus: <entryFree id="n6029" type="main" key="caeli^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭflŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum -fluo</etym>, <sense id="n6029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing from heaven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Nat. S. Fel. 12, 780</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caeligenus: <entryFree id="n6030" type="main" key="caeli^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭgĕnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n6030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaven-born</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Victoria et Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl></cit> Müll.: stellae, App. de Mundo, p. 57, 29.</sense></entryFree>
caeliger: <entryFree id="n6031" type="main" key="caeli^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caelum-gero</etym>, <sense id="n6031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaven supporting</hi>: Atlas, Avien Phaenom. 575.</sense></entryFree>
caeliloquus: <entryFree id="n6032" type="main" key="caeli^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭlŏquus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n6032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [cae <pb n="263" /> <cb n="CAEL" /> lum-loquor], <hi rend="ital">heavenly speaking</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 60, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caelimontium: <entryFree id="n6033" type="main" key="Caeli^monti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭmontĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coel-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Caelius-mons</etym>, <sense id="n6033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the second region of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">including the Cœlian Hill</hi>, P. Vict. Reg. Urb. R.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭmontānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coel-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cœlimontium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CAMPVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2617</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caelina: <entryFree id="n6034" type="main" key="Caeli_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Venetia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caeliolus: <entryFree id="n6035" type="main" key="Caeli^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭŏlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coel-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Caelius</etym>, <sense id="n6035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of the Cœlian Hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46</bibl> Müll. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 32</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭ-cŭlus</orth>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 6</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭus Mĭnor</orth>）</sense></entryFree>
caelipotens: <entryFree id="n6036" type="hapax" key="caeli^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭ-pŏtens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <sense id="n6036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi> [caelum], <hi rend="ital">powerful in heaven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caelispex: <entryFree id="n6037" type="main" key="Caeli^spex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭspex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coel-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Caeliusspicio</etym>, <sense id="n6037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">looking towards the Cœlian Hill</hi> Apollo, <hi rend="ital">a place at Rome</hi>, perh. named after the statue of Apollo placed there, Sex. Ruf. and P. Vict. Reg. Urb. R.</sense></entryFree>
caelitus: <entryFree id="n6038" type="main" key="caeli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coel-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>caelum</etym>. <sense id="n6038.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From heaven</hi> (late Lat. for divinitus or caelo) omnia quae caelitus mortalibus exhibentur, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6038.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">from the emperor</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 32, 2; 10, 20, 16.</sense></entryFree>
caelius: <entryFree id="n6039" type="main" key="Caeli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coel-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n6039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman gentile name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6039.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The orator</hi> M. Caelius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">for whom Cicero made an oration</hi>, and whose letters to Cicero are contained in the 8th book of the Epp. ad Famil.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 115</bibl>; v. Teuffel, Röm. Litt. § 206, 5 sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cœlian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6039.2" n="B" level="2"> L. Caelius Antipater, <hi rend="ital">a distinguished historian and jurist in the time of the Gracchi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and teacher of Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the writings of Cœlius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 8</bibl>; v. Teuffel. Röm. Litt. § 142.—</sense><sense id="n6039.3" n="C" level="2"> C. Caelius Caldus, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6039.4" n="D" level="2"> Caelius Aurelianus, <hi rend="ital">a physician of the post - classic period</hi>, v. Teuffel, Röm. Litt. § 456.—</sense><sense id="n6039.5" n="II" level="1"> Caelius Mons, <hi rend="ital">the Cœlian Hill at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of</hi> Palatinus, <hi rend="ital">and east of</hi> Aventinus, named after the Tuscan Caeles Vibenna (pure Etrusc. Kaile Fipne), now <hi rend="ital">the Lateran Mount</hi>, Varr L. L. 5, § 46 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 65</bibl>.—Called Caelius Major, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 16</bibl>; cf. Caeliolus.—<hi rend="ital">The soldiers of this Caeles are called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caelĭāni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">CAELIANVS EXERCITVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 502, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caelo: <entryFree id="n6040" type="main" key="caelo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. caelum</etym>. <sense id="n6040.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, answering to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">toreu/w</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to engrave in relief upon metals</hi> (esp. silver) or <hi rend="ital">wory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make raised work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engrave;</hi> later also, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> (cf. O. Müll. Archaeol. § 311 sq.; and v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 8</bibl>, s. v. caelatura; Fest. s. v. ancaesa, p. 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 4, 7</bibl>)' ab initio sic opus ducere, ut caelandum, non ex integro fabricandum sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc speciem Praxiteles caelavit argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeas aere Corinthio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelata in auro Fortia facta patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeo quoque flumina septem Argento partim, partim caelaverat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 189</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl>; 13, 684: scuta auro, argento, Liv 9, 40, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 10, 7: vasa magnifica et pretiose caelata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa caelata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 24, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">centauros in scyphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 156</bibl></cit>: libidines in poculis, id. prooem. § 4 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">Liv 23, 24, 12: caelatum aurum et argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
