Am. 46, 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelata metus alios arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:402" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phorcys caelatus Gorgone parmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:175" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6040.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">engrave on other materials</hi> (cf. caelatura, I. B.); <cit><quote lang="la">upon wood: pocula ponam Fagina, caelatum divini opus Alcimedontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in marble: caelavit Scopas pteron ab oriente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitrum) argenti modo caelatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6040.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of other works of art. </sense><sense id="n6040.3" n="A" level="2"> Of skilful weaving or embroidering: <cit><quote lang="la">velamina caelata multā arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6040.4" n="B" level="2"> Of poetry: carmina compono, hio elegos. Mirabile <cb n="CAEL" /> visu Caelatumque novem musis (i. e. a novem musis) opus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6040.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem modo caelatum stellis Delphina videbas, i. e. the constellation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caelum: <entryFree id="n6041" type="main" key="caelum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 640</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n6041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chisel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burin of the sculptor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">engraver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a graver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelata vasa... a caelo vocata, quod est genus ferramenti, quem vulgo cilionem vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 24</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 99, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 57, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6042" type="main" key="caelum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">coelum</orth>; cf. Aelius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 18</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 4, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cae-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 197, 9</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 59</bibl>; cf. the foll. I. 2.; <number>plur.</number> caeli, only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1097" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1097</bibl>, caelos, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 331</bibl>; and in eccl. writers freq. for the Heb. <foreign />, <sense id="n6042.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, cf. Caes. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 3 sq.</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 21</bibl> P., who consider the <number>plur.</number> in gen. as not in use, v. Rudd. I. p. 109. From <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 3</bibl>: unum caelum esset an innumerabilia, nothing can be positively inferred.—Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cael</orth>: divum domus altisonum cael, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Technop. 13, 17</bibl>, or Ann. v. 561 Vahl.) [for cavilum, root in cavus; cf. Sanscr. çva-, to swell, be hollow; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ku/w, koi=los</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">the sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the vault of heaven</hi> (in Lucr alone more than 150 times): hoc inde circum supraque, quod complexu continet terram, id quod nostri caelum memorant, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 17</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante mare et terras et quod tegit omnia caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis pariter (potis est) caelos omnīs convortere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1097" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1097</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boat caelum fremitu virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:73" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid deorum in caelo regit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides pluere, fulmina jaci de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence the phrase de caelo tangi, <hi rend="ital">to be struck with lightning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23, 5</bibl> Drak.; 29, 14, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also, e caelo ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.1" n="2" level="3"> Personified: Caelus (Caelum, Hyg. Fab. praef.), <hi rend="ital">son of</hi> Aether <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Dies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">father of Saturn</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 197, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 63</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Vulcan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 55</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Mercury and the first Venus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 59</bibl>, Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:297 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 297 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6042.2" n="3" level="3"> In the lang. of augury: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo servare,</quote> <trans><tr>to observe the signs of heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo fieri, of celestial signs,</quote> <trans><tr>to appear</tr>, <tr>occur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.3" n="4" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si nunc caelum ruat? of a vain fear,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit> Don.; cf. Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 499, 24</bibl>: delabi caelo, <hi rend="ital">to drop down from the sky</hi>, of sudden or unexpected good fortune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl>; cf.. caelo missus, Tib 1, 3, 90; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidere de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: caelum ac terras miscere, <hi rend="ital">to confound every thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overturn all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise chaos</hi>, Liv 4, 3, 6; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 790</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 25</bibl>: findere caelum aratro, of an impossibility, Ov Tr 1, 8, 3: toto caelo errare, <hi rend="ital">to err very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entirely mistaken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 12, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.4" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> caeli in a pun with Caeli, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of Caelius, Serv. et Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 105</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6042.5" n="6" level="3"> In eccl. Lat. the <hi rend="ital">plur</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">caeli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, is very freq., <hi rend="ital">the heavens</hi>, Tert. de Fuga, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6042.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Heaven</hi>, in a more restricted sense; <hi rend="ital">the region of heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a climate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuicumque particulae caeli officeretur, quamvis esset procul, mutari lumina putabat,</quote> <trans><tr>to whatever part of the horizon</tr>, <tr>however distant</tr>, <tr>the view was obstructed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc caelum, sub quo natus educatusque essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 2, 2</bibl>, §§ 16 and 19 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:62" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum non animum mutant, qui trans mare currunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atmosphere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weather</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc caelo, qui dicitur aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum hoc, in quo nubes, imbres ventique coguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue et concretum caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: commoda, quae percipiuntur caeli temperatione,<cb n="CAEN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caell intemperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. prooem. 1' intemperantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">varium caeli morem praediscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varietas et mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli solique clementia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subita mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:10:9 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 9 al.</bibl></cit>—With <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palustre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 31, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedum imbribus ac nebulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit hiems Veliae, quod caelum Salerni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6042.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Daytime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">day</hi> (very rare): albente caelo, <hi rend="ital">at break of day</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 68</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 11; 80; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem die albescente caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:25:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 25, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesperascente caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>in the evening twilight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons in caelum attollitur,</quote> <trans><tr>toward heaven</tr>, <tr>heavenwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Verg.: aequata machina caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 89</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upper world</hi> in opposition to the lower world: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa ad caelum mittunt insomnia Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:896" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 896</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abode of the happy dead</hi>, etc. (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 15</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (animus) exierit et in liberum caelum quasi domum suam venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non ad mortem trudi, verum in caelum videretur escendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6042.12" n="F" level="1"> Trop, <hi rend="ital">the summit of prosperity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar in caelum fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonem ferebat in caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>praised</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te summis laudibus ad caelum extulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 25, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae etiam tu in caelum ferebas,</quote> <trans><tr>extolled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo tenus extollere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelo ponere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:,4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ,4,14</bibl></cit>; and: exaequare aliquem caelo, Lucr 1, 79; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonem caelo aequavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo Musa beat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recludere caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the opp.: collegam de caelo detraxisti,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of his exalted honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 107</bibl></cit>: in caelo sum, <hi rend="ital">I am in heaven</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">am very happy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito caelum attingere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be extremely fortunate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum accepisse fatebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 844</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc tangam vertice caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum merere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6042.13" n="G" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum camerarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the interior surface of a vault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:30" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 30</bibl> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caelus: <entryFree id="n6043" type="main" key="caelus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caelus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. caelum <sense id="n6043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> and I. 2.</sense></entryFree>
caementa: <entryFree id="n6044" type="main" key="caementa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caementa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. caementum.</entryFree>
caementarius: <entryFree id="n6045" type="main" key="caementa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caementārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caementum</etym>, <sense id="n6045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone-cutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a builder of walls</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caementicius: <entryFree id="n6046" type="main" key="caementi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caementīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tītĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to quarried stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of them</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">structurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: saxum <hi rend="ital">unhewn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarry-stone</hi> (opp quadratum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
caementum: <entryFree id="n6047" type="main" key="caementum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caementum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cae-menta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, like armenta, ae, to armentum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 196, 30</bibl>, or Trag. v. 422 Vahl.; v 373 Rib.) [contr. from caedimentum, from caedo; hence Engl. cement]. <sense id="n6047.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhewn stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it comes from the quarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quarry-stone</hi>, used for walls. </sense><sense id="n6047.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (so most freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 3</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 96, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam insulam materiem, calcem, caementa, arma convexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 47, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 22, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6047.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 48, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 76, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6047.3" n="II" level="1"> Caementa marmorea, <hi rend="ital">pieces that fly off from marble in working</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chips of marble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementa marmorea, sive assulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caena: <entryFree id="n6048" type="main" key="caena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caena</orth> and its derivv., v. cena, etc.</entryFree>
caeneus: <entryFree id="n6049" type="main" key="Caeneus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caeneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕos</itype> (<sense id="n6049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:644" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 644</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Caenĭ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 470</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeneu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 531</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kaineu/s</foreign>, orig. <hi rend="ital">a girl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named</hi> Cænis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 201</bibl>; 12, 470 sq., <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Elatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards changed by Neptune into a boy</hi>, <pb n="264" /> <cb n="CAEP" /> he was subsequently present at the Calydonian hunt. and at the contest of the Centaurs and Lapithæ, and finally was metamorphosed into a bird. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 459</bibl> sq.; 12, 514 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; acc. to Verg. he again became a female. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 448</bibl> Serv.—</sense><sense id="n6049.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 573</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caenina: <entryFree id="n6050" type="main" key="Caeni_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caenīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kaininh</foreign>, <sense id="n6050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small but very ancient town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Rome</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ciano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6050.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv </sense><sense id="n6050.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caenīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cœnina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SACERDOTIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 436, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caenīnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cœnina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 10, 2</bibl> and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:135" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6050.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caenīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cœnina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">Acron,</quote> <trans><tr>king of the Cœninenses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">nomen = Caeninenses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caenis: <entryFree id="n6051" type="main" key="Caenis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caenis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n6051.0" n="I" level="1"> V Caeneus.—</sense><sense id="n6051.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mistress of Vespasian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caenophrurium: <entryFree id="n6052" type="main" key="Caenophru_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caenophrūrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-frūrĭum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the road from Apollonia to Selymbria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bivados</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 35, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caenositas: <entryFree id="n6053" type="main" key="caeno^si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caenŏsĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <sense id="n6053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [caenosus], <hi rend="ital">a dirty place;</hi> only trop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont. Virg. p. 156</bibl> Munk.</sense></entryFree>
caenosus: <entryFree id="n6054" type="main" key="caeno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caenōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caenum</etym>, <sense id="n6054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">muddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshy</hi> (rare): lacus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges (i. e. Styx),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:266" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 266</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caenosior liquor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6054.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: impuritas, Salv. Gub. Dei, 3, 10.</sense></entryFree>
caenulentus: <entryFree id="n6055" type="main" key="caenu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caenŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with mud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caenum: <entryFree id="n6056" type="main" key="caenum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caenum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">coenum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cunio</etym>, <sense id="n6056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mire</hi> (always with access. idea of loathsomeness, diff. from limus, lutum, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes stultos insanire, ut male olere omne caenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 54</bibl></cit>; freq. and class. in prose and poetry); <cit><quote lang="la">prop.: pulchrum ornatum turpes mores pejus caeno collinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:977" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 977</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 418</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:25" default="NO">4, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cloacarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:6" default="NO">7, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:502" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 502</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 13</bibl>.— Prov.: mordicus petere e caeno cibum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 138, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6056.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncleanness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum ex lutulento caeno propere hinc eliciat foras (sc. ex amore meretricum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenebris volvi caenoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex caeno plebeio consulatum extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—Also as a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">dirty fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile fellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 18, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caepa: <entryFree id="n6057" type="main" key="caepa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caepa</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and equally freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">caepe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cēpe</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n6057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> caepis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 43</bibl> P., without voucher, but the assertion of the gram. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 314</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 681</bibl> ib.; Phocae Ars, p. 1706 ib., and Serg. p. 1842 ib., that caepe is indecl., is also unsubstantiated, since the form of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> caepe cited by Prisc. l. l. from App. is the well-known later orthog. for caepae; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 551; 1, 557 sq.; 1, 578; in <number>plur.</number> only caepae or <itype>cepae, ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; cf. Don. p. 1747 P.; Prisc. l. l.; Phoc. l. l.; Serg. l. l.; Rudd. I. p. 114, n. 36; a rare form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cae-pitium</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>) [etym. dub.; cf.: et capiti nomen debentia cepa, v. l. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 74</bibl>; but acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 43</bibl>, from a <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>], <hi rend="ital">an onion;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kro/muon</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:101 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 101 sq.</bibl> </sense><sense id="n6057.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <itype>Caepa, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Naev. and Lucil. ap. Prisc. l. l.; Lucil. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10</bibl>. 12, 3; 12, 10, 2; 12, 8, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:340" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32</bibl>, §§ 101 and 106; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6057.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <itype>Caepe, is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5, 5</bibl>; Naev., Nov., and Varr. ap. Prisc. l. l.; Lucil. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6057.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <itype>Caepae, ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 5, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:20" default="NO">12, 32, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24, 3</bibl>. Among the Egyptians considered a sacred plant, Plin. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caeparia: <entryFree id="n6058" type="hapax" key="caepa_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caepārĭa</orth>. <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caepa</etym>, <sense id="n6058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease in the privy members</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caeparius: <entryFree id="n6059" type="hapax" key="caepa_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caepārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trader in onions.</hi> Lucil ap Non. p 201, 10. <cb n="CAER" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6060" type="main" key="Caepa_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caepārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name;</hi> esp., M. Caeparius, <hi rend="ital">an adherent of Catiline.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caepasius: <entryFree id="n6061" type="main" key="Caepasi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caepasĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esp., C. and L. Caepasius,</quote> <trans><tr>two orators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69</bibl></cit>. 242; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 20, 57</bibl>; Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 17.</sense></entryFree>
caepina: <entryFree id="n6062" type="main" key="caepi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caepīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cēp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caepuila</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 11, 4</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caepa; anal. to napina, porrina. rapina; lit., <pos>adj.</pos>, sc. planta</etym>, <sense id="n6062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a field</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bed of onions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:56 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 56 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
caepitium: <entryFree id="n6063" type="main" key="caepitium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caepitium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. caepa.</entryFree>
caepuila: <entryFree id="n6064" type="main" key="caepuila"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caepuila</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. caepina <sense id="n6064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
caere: <entryFree id="n6065" type="main" key="Caere"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caere</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> (<sense id="n6065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Caerĭtis. <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 597</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Caerēte, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 183</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*kairh</foreign> Steph., <foreign lang="greek">*kaire/a</foreign> Strab., <hi rend="ital">a very ancient city of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the twelve;</hi> previously called Agylla, now <hi rend="ital">Cervetri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 597</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 183</bibl>; Liv 1, 60, 2.—</sense><sense id="n6065.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6065.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caeres</orth>, <itype>ĭtis and ētis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cœre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cœritic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 10</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerĭtes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Caerētes</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cœre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19, 8</bibl> and 10; 7, 20, 1; 5, 50, 3. In consequence of assisting the Romans in the Gallic war, they received the privilege of Roman citizenship, but without the jus suffragii. Hence the catalogues of such quasi-citizens were called tabulae Caerites or Caeritum, and Roman citizens, in consequence of disfranchisement inflicted by the censor, were enrolled in these, being deprived of the right of voting; <cit><quote lang="la">hence the odious access. idea of the expression in tabulas Caerites (um) referri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be degraded</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Div. in Caecil. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Div. in Caecil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 7 sq.</bibl>—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">Caerite cerā ( = tabulā) digni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1, 6, 62</bibl></cit> (notā infamiae et omni ignominiā digni sumus, Schol. Crucq.).—</sense><sense id="n6065.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerētā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Cœre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6065.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cae-rētānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a country-seat near Cœre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6065.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerētāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vina), <hi rend="ital">wine from Cœre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:124" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 124</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6065.6" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerētāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cœre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caerefolium: <entryFree id="n6066" type="greek" key="caere^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerĕfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">chaerĕphyl-lum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:110" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 110</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xaire/fullon</foreign>, whence the Fr. cerfeuil, and Germ. Kerbel</etym>, <sense id="n6066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chervil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caeretes: <entryFree id="n6067" type="main" key="Caere_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerētes</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Caerētānus</orth>, v. Caere.</entryFree>
caerimonia: <entryFree id="n6068" type="main" key="caeri^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerĭmōnĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭ-</orth>; scanned cĕrīmōnĭa, Prud. c. Symm. praef. 1, 5), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">caerĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Gloss. Lat. pp. 50, 69 Hild.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3188</bibl>) [kindr. with Sanscr. root kri, = facere; cf. also creo. cerus, Ceres. strictly sacred work, divine rite; cf. Bopp, Gloss. p. 79, a; Pott, I. p. 219; Mommsen, Unterit. Dial.], <sense id="n6068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sacred. the divine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which has reference to the Deity</hi> (in class. prose) </sense><sense id="n6068.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6068.2" n="A" level="2"> Objectively, <hi rend="ital">sacredness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity</hi> (in this sense rare, and only in <number>sing.</number>): sanctitas regum, et caerimonia deorum. Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl>: legationis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: 3, 61: loci. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n6068.3" n="B" level="2"> Subjectively, <hi rend="ital">a holy dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veneration of the Deity</hi> (external; while religio has regard both to internal and external reverence for God; rare except in <number>sing.</number>). <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 2</bibl>. 22, 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14</bibl>. § 36; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22</bibl>. 55; 2, 53, 161: sacra summā religione caerimoniāque conficere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 24</bibl>. 55: so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Har Resp. 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 37</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29</bibl>. 18, 2; 40, 4, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4</bibl>. 9. 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl>' esse in magnā caerimoniā. <hi rend="ital">to be held in great veneration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 135</bibl>; also <number>plur.</number>: habere aliquid in caerimoniis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6068.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a religious usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacred rite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious ceremony</hi> (while ritus designates both religious and profane rites: so esp. freq. in the histt. and mostly in <number>plur.</number>): Ceres et Libera. quarum sacra... longe maximis atque occultissimis caerimoniis continentur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 187</bibl>: religiones vero caerimoniaeque omnium sacrorum fanorumque violatae. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl>. 1. 3. § 7: in sacerdotio caerimoniisque diligentissimus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: caelestes. Liv 1, 20, 4 and 7' polluere. id. <cb n="CAER" /> 6, 41, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl>: fetiales. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspiciaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: vetustissimae. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl>. 62: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl></cit>; 16, 28; <cit><quote lang="la">publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl>: an tiquae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinae, veteres ac praeceptae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 36</bibl></cit>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatis militaribus signis, quo more eorum gravissima caerimonia continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
caerimonialis: <entryFree id="n6069" type="hapax" key="caeri^mo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caerimonia</etym>, <sense id="n6069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to religious rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceremonial;</hi> officia. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caerimonior: <entryFree id="n6070" type="main" key="caeri^mo_nior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerĭmōnior</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n6070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to treat with due ceremony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to worship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 309" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 309</bibl>; Act. St. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caerimoniosus: <entryFree id="n6071" type="main" key="caeri^mo_ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerĭmōnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per taining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devoted to religious rites</hi>' dies. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caerites: <entryFree id="n6072" type="main" key="Caeri^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerĭtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Caere, II. A.</entryFree>
caeroesi: <entryFree id="n6073" type="main" key="Caeroesi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caeroesi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Caeraes-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Belgian tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ce-rosi</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 7</bibl></sense></entryFree>
caerulans: <entryFree id="n6074" type="hapax" key="caeru^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caerulus = caeruleus</etym>, <sense id="n6074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sky-blue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa caerulanti peplo circumdata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>astrono my</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caeruleatus: <entryFree id="n6075" type="hapax" key="caeru^le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerŭlĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caeruleus</etym>, <sense id="n6075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sky-blue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plancus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the color of a sea-god</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caeruleus: <entryFree id="n6076" type="main" key="caeru^le^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caerŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>and in poetry equally common</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">caerŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. cae -sius, <foreign lang="greek">ku/anos</foreign>, and Sanscr. cjamas = dark</etym> <sense id="n6076.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dark-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cerulean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">azure</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kua/neos</foreign>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the sky, of the sea, and other similar objects (as dark, opp. albus and marmoreus color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:771 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 771 sq.</bibl>, and syn. with ater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl>; v. under II. A.). </sense><sense id="n6076.1" n="A" level="2"> Of the sky: caeli caerula templa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 50 Vahl.); id. ap. Varr, L. L. 7, § 6 Müll. (Ann. v. 66 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(zonae) extremae Caeruleā glacie concretae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 236</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caerŭla</orth>. <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 814</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per caeli caerula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1089" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1089</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:96" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 96</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 482</bibl></cit>.—Of the universe: <cit><quote lang="la">magni per caerula mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 770</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the brightness of the stars: bigae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 37</bibl></cit>.—Of mountain heights, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 158</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">candor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 28, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 51, § 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6076.2" n="B" level="2"> Of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">ponti plaga caerula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 482</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:772 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 772 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 838</bibl>: mare, Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 162, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">campi = mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 699</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:45" default="NO">1, 4, 45</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 254, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color (lacus) caerulo albidi or, viridior et pressior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani amictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 11</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cae-rŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the blue surface of the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerula verrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 583</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:250" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 250</bibl>.—Of objects that have relation to the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-deities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>: deus, <foreign lang="greek">kat) .e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 7, 62; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: Jovis frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Triton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>. 333: Nereus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the same: mater (sc. Achillis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Psamathe,</quote> <trans><tr>a sea-nymph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:398" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 398</bibl></cit>: oculi Neptuni. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus (Neptuni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 819</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi (Tritonis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylla (navis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">color. Ov M. 14, 555: puppis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 112</bibl></cit>; via. Plaut Rud. 1, 5, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6076.3" n="C" level="2"> Also of rivers and things that are connected therewith: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleus Thybris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 64</bibl></cit> amnis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:51" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 51</bibl>: Cydnus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 432</bibl></cit>; guttae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:633" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 633</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6076.4" n="D" level="2"> Of other darkblue objects: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes se Britanni vitro inficiunt, quod caeruleum efficit colorem, atque hoc horridiores sunt in pugnā aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an si caeruleo quaedam sua tempora fuco Tinxerit. idcirco caerula forma bona'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18:31 sq" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18, 31 sq.</bibl></cit> (3, 11, 9 sq.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:53:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 53, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olearum plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1372</bibl></cit>; draco. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 13</bibl>' angues, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 482</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae (serpentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:578" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 578</bibl></cit>: vestis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2</bibl>. 97: <cit><quote lang="la">vexillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos (heliotropi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi (Germanorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>; hence Germania<pb n="265" /> <cb n="CAES" />  pubes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caerŭlĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a blue color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steel-color</hi>, both natural and artificial, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:161 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 161 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:47" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 28, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6076.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6076.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of death, the night, rain, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">stant Manibus arae Caeruleis moestae vittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 194</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 10: caeruleus (color) pluviam denuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 453</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">equi (Plutonis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:446" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 28, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis (Charontis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:ad Liv. 1:93" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> ad Liv. 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:528" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 528</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca (lauri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacis caerula tinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 98</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6076.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Dark green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor Palladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 518</bibl></cit>: campi caerula laetaque prata, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6077" type="main" key="Caeru^le^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caerŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an aqueduct at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
